*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Sindangan-Upper Inuman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del N

loans.name: Cyprian

texts.en: Cyprian M. is 37 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom attend school.  He runs a barber shop at Kagundo. Cyprian was introduced to KADET LTD by the credit officer in charge of the Tala office.  Cyprian has been running this business for 10 years and his monthly profit is 10,000 KES. This 30,000 KES loan is Cyprian's fourth loan from KADET LTD and his previous loans were paid on time. He intends to use the loan to buy new shaving machines, chemicals, and towels. If this loan boosts the business Cyprian will pay school fees and buy food for his children.  He dreams of having a big barber shop and he describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy new shaving machines, chemicals, and towels

loans.name: Pinina Armandina

texts.es: Pinina es una señora muy alegre, trabajadora es positiva y emprendedora. Ella a sus 34 años de edad está logrando sus objetivos poco a poco. Tiene una pequeña bodeguita en su casa desde hace 10 años, con los ingresos de este pequeño negocio logró mejorar el ambiente de su bodega, parte de estos ingresos lo utiliza para pagar los gastos de la casa  y la educación de sus dos hijos quienes aún son menores de edad. Ella solicitó el préstamo a EDAPROSPO para comprar más mercadería (arroz, azúcar, leche, pollo, verduras) para su bodega. A Pinina le gustaría comprarse una combi para transporte público y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pinina is a very cheerful, hard-working, positive and enterprising lady.  She is 34 years old and is gradually achieving her goals in life.

Pinina has a small grocery store in her home which she has had for 10 years.  She has used the profits from this small business to improve the store's environment.  She uses part of her profits to cover her household expenses and to pay for the education of her two children who are still dependent on her.

Pinina requested this loan from EDAPROSPO to buy more merchandise (rice, sugar, milk, chicken, vegetables) for her store.  She would like to buy a van for providing public transport and thereby improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk, chicken and vegetables for her store

loans.name: Pendeza Group

texts.fr: Tembeya R. Antoinnette  est entrepreneur, trésorière du groupe, âgée de 45 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants dont 2 enfants etudient, 2 n’étudient pas faute de moyens financiers et 2 autres ont leurs propres foyers.  Son conjoint est chômeur, sans emploi. La cliente Tembeya R. Antoinnette    est vendeuse des  tomates, arachides, légumes, oignons, etc. au marchee sectoriel de Ndosho. Elle  commença ce business  avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Avant de joindre cette activité, jadis, elle vendait les divers dans un kiosque. Son capital d’affaire initial fut 30$. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le premier crédit de l’IMF Hekima de 50$ au début de  2010. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux produits (2 paniers de tomates, 50 kg d’arachides, etc.) et  ajouter un nouveau produits celui de vente poisson, qu’elle veut également entreprendre pour diversifie son business.  En plus, elle ambitionne acheter une parcelle et construire et laisser la vie de locataire. La cliente Tembeya R. Antoinnette  remercie Hekima pour  ses crédits sans relance en faveur de pauvres. Le groupe Pendeza est constitué de 32 membres.
texts.en: Tembeya R. Antoinnette is an entrepreneur and she is the treasurer of the group. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children. Two of her children are in school, 2 are not going to school for the lack of financial resources, and 2 have their own homes. Her husband is unemployed. Tembeya R. Antoinnette is a merchant who sells tomatoes, peanuts, vegetables, onions etc, at in the sector's market of Ndosho. She started her business with her own money, which she received from her husband. Prior to the business she has currently, she sold various merchandise from a kiosk. Her start up capital funds was $30. In early 2010, she benefited from a loan from IMF Hekima (Kiva Field Partner) amounting to $50. This new loan will be used to purchase more products (2 baskets of tomatoes, 50Kg of peanuts, etc.) and to add new products for resale, including fish, and to diversify her business. In addition she would like to purchase a parcel of land where to build a life as a homeowner. Tembeya R. Antoinnette is thankful to Hekima for the loans granted to the poor. The group Pendeza is made up of 32 members.

loans.use: To purchase 2 baskets of tomatoes, 50kg of peanuts, and fish.

loans.name: San Agustín Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la compañía Hjugua Hu de la ciudad de Caacupé.
La Presidenta del comité es la Sra. Rilcy Y., ella es una mujer muy correcta, honesta y trabajadora, Doña Rilcy viven con su marido, que también tiene un pequeño negocio, y sus cuatro hijos, de los cuales tres van a la escuela.
La Sra. Rilcy sale todos los días con su pequeño catálogo a ofrecer sus joyas, recorre varios barrios de Caacupé y también ciudades cercanas para vender sus productos.
Gracias a este programa ella cuenta con un pequeño capital para poder tener más productos para la venta y así poder generar más ingresos para ella y su familia.
Ella y todas sus compañeras del comité están muy contentas y agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva por el apoyo que les brinda através del Programa comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
texts.en: The women of the present committee are from the Hjugua company in the city of Caacupé.  The committee's president is Mrs. Rilcy Y..  She is an upstanding, honest, hard-working woman who lives with her husband, who also has a small-business, and her four children who are in school.  Mrs. Rilcy goes out everyday with her small catalog to sell jewelery.  She goes to various neighborhoods in Caacupé and also nearby cities to sell her products.  Thanks to this program, she can count on some capital so she can have more products to sell and generate more income for her and her family.  She, and all her friends in the group are very happy and grateful to the Fundacion Paraguaya and Kiva for the support they provide through the communal bank "Mujeres Emprendedoras."

loans.use: To purchase earrings, bracelets, chains, medals, rings.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira S.  lives in Osh city, in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 45 years old and has two children. Elmira graduated from the Textile University in Ukraine as a production engineer. She is known as a very communicative and responsive person.

To find a means of subsistence for her family and help her husband to cover the family’s expenses, Elmira started her business in selling women’s clothes and trousers, using her start-up capital of 40,000 KGS. Year in and year out, she managed to broaden her business by widening her assortment of goods.  She also paid for the education of her daughter in China
  
But in June 2010, when violent clashes caused by the deposed political regime broke out in the Osh city, Elmira lost her business, which was robbed and looted. Her husband, who supported and helped her in all activities, was injured in a shootout during the clashes and died.  This tragedy became a hard blow for Elmira’s family and children.

However, Elmira isn't giving up.  She is ready to resume her lost business and continue to work. For this very reason, Elmira is applying for a loan of 135,000 KGS, which she needs to restart her business selling women's clothes. She plans to rent a selling point at the local market.  With the revenues she anticipates from the business, she plans to pay for education for her son. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas, leading to increased employment and meeting the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina Isabel S. D. L., D. treinta y tres años D. edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos menores D. edad que estudian y esposo en municipio y departamento D. La Libertad, Reina posee desD. hace mas D. 10 años un puesto en el muelle del Puerto D. La Libertad, lugar que es prácticamente una plaza D. venta D. mariscos y en el que ella cuenta con mucha clientela local y externa. Todos los días es su esposo Don René quien se encarga D. suministrar el pescado que venD. Reina, es decir, él es pescador artesanal, le lleva varios tipos D. pescado: boca colorada, mojarra, curvina, lonja, caite, camarón, jaiba, entre otros. Es preferida por lo fresco D. sus mariscos y ahora sus clientes están empezando a encargarle el acostumbrado pescado seco usado para tortas D. pescado, es por ello que necesita D. este crédito y poder suplir la necesidad D. sus clientes y obtener con ello ganancias para estos próximos días D. temporada D. verano.-
texts.en:
Reina Isabel S. D. L., age 33, lives with her three young children, who attend school, and her husband in the municipality and department of La Libertad. For more than 10 years, Reina has had a stall in the harbor area of Puerto D. la Libertad, a place that, for all practical purposes, is a plaza for selling seafood. She has a lot of customers from close by and further away.

Every day, her husband, Don René, supplies the fish that Reina sells. He fishes by hand catching several types of fish: red snapper, sunfish, sea bass, lonja, mackerel, shrimp, and crabs, among others.

She is preferred because of the freshness of her seafood and now her customers are beginning to order custom dried fish used for fish cakes. She needs this loan in order to be able to meet the needs of her customers and to obtain earnings for the upcoming summer season.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish for the summer season.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 34 years. She has 5 children who are between the ages of 3 and 5. Her husband sells different kinds of merchandise. Alphonsine owns a shop in which she sells different food stuffs such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

Alphonsine is requesting a loan to buy more items and fill her shop and make more profits. She plans to pay her children school fees with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy items for her shop

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry Odera N. is 30 years old and married to Tabitha who is a business lady. He supports four people. Henry runs a motorcycle transport business in Nyatike, Migori town. He has been in this business for 16 years and earns a good income.     


He learned about KADET LTD through a friend, and he has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan amount to buy another motorbike for the business.              


Henry intends to use the anticipated profit to save and pay school fees for his children.  In future he plans to grow his business and be able to manage many motorbikes for hire.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Olga M. es la Directora General de este comité, la misma se dedica a la venta de ropas y perfumes, ella es soltera y tiene 2 hijos pequeños, es la única que genera ingresos en su hogar y por tal motivo sería de mucha utilidad para ella y su familia el crédito que solicita a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva, ya que lo destinaría en su totalidad a la compra de mercaderías para la venta, como perfumes y colonias.
Este grupo del Barrio San Isidro de la ciudad de Encarnacion, surgió por contacto de las señoras  con la Fundación Paraguaya, el grupo se encuentra en el 2º ciclo, opera con la institución desde el año 2010.
Todas las mujeres son personas muy trabajadoras, luchan cada día contra todos los obstáculos que puedan tener para sobresalir, pues desean con mucha fe sacar adelante a sus familias, haceles progresar y superar la pobreza que últimamente se ha vuelto un mal generalizado en muchos sectores de nuestro país.
Las integrantes poseen muy buenas referencias crediticias, por lo que han obtenido la confianza de esta fundación en varias ocasiones, y esperan contar con la misma confianza de Kiva.
texts.en:
This group is from the San Isidro neighborhood of the city of Encarnacion. It came about thanks to the contact that its members had with Fundación Paraguaya; the group is now in its 2nd loan cycle and has been with Fundación Paraguaya since 2010.

Olga M. is the director of this group. She makes her living selling clothing and perfume; she is single and has two small children. Olga is the only breadwinner in her household so the loan she is seeking from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva would be very useful to her and her family. She will use the loan to purchase an inventory of merchandise, such as perfume and cologne.

All the women in the group are very hardworking people; they struggle every day against all the obstacles so that they could get ahead and have an earnest desire to help their families move forward, to make progress, to overcome the poverty that has recently become a general scourge in many parts of our country.

The members have very good credit references as they have earned the trust of this foundation on several occasions; they hope to be able to have the same level of trust with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase perfume and cologne

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a cosmetics sales business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy more beauty supplies for her cosmetics sales business. Merlinda has been in this business for 12 years. Merlinda earns additional income selling RTW [Ready To Wear] clothing.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty supplies to sell to customers.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is from the village of Tinabalan, Gingoog City.  He is 48 years old. Jimmy is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Jimmy owns & operates a business providing motorela or habal-habal services to local community members. Jimmy has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jimmy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jimmy is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools and necessities needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jimmy from HSPFI.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools & necessities needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a hardworking Filipina entrepreneur who has had a motorcycle transport business for the past seventeen years. She also farms sugarcane, has a general store and fattens pigs.

Agnes has been sustaining her businesses through her own effort and with the help of loans from NWTF. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts to maintain her motorcycle.

Agnes dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to maintain her motorcycle.

loans.name: Eleuterio Jacinto

texts.es: El señor Eleuterio,  es soltero pero tiene 2 hijos que ya son mayores es por ello que no están a su cargo, vive en casa propia que logro construir con mucho esfuerzo, Eleuterio se dedica a arreglar bicicletas brindando mantenimiento a las mismas , empezó a realizar esta actividad en un local pequeño, pero con el correr del tiempo ya tiene un local mas amplio, Eleuterio es muy conocido en la zona, el dinero del préstamo será invertido en  comprar materiales  como ladrillos, arena, cemento, fierro, para el techado de su casa y otra parte para pagarle al albañil , su sueño en el futuro es terminar de construir su casa con acabados para tener una mejor calidad de vida, Eleuterio esta muy agradecido con la confianza que le estamos brindando.
texts.en: Señor Eleuterio is unmarried but he has 2 children who are grown so they are not in his care.  He lives in his own home which he managed to build with much effort.   Eleuterio's occupation is providing maintenance for bicycles and fixing them.  He began this activity in a small way, but over time he has expanded it.  Eleuterio is well known in the area.  The loan will be invested in purchasing materials such as bricks, sand, cement, and iron for the roof and other parts of his home and to pay the builder.  His dream for the future is to finish building his house to have a better quality of life.  Eleuterio is very grateful for the confidence in him that we are providing.

loans.use: to improve his home and purchase sand, cement and iron for the roof of his home

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 52 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Nora is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nora has been farming rice for four years and earns additional income from buying & selling fruit.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.en: Umedjon is married and has two children. He's been working as a taxi driver for four years. Umedjon would like a loan of 9,000 somoni to help purchase spare parts for his vehicle. He likes being independent and is a real go-getter. Umedjon wanted to start his own business and he achieved his goal. Now, as he sets new goals for the future, he is hoping that additional financial assistance will help him grow business-wise and become self-sustainable and successful. ====================================== More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for thorough fixing of his car.

loans.name: Teresa Gerarda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACSA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teresa Gerarda; ella tiene 34 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de papa, ella vende en el mercado de Huancaro desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, ella tiene un puesto donde vende toda variedad de papa, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante  a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de papa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar 10 sacos de papa.
 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The loan recipient belongs to the village bank "Virgen Asunta de Rasca" located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Teresa Gerarda, 34, lives with her husband and 2 children. She sells potatoes in the market in Huancaro from 7:00am until 6:00pm. She has a stall where she sells different varieties of potatoes. Through this business she has been able to help her children get ahead. She wants to expand her potato-selling business. She asks for a loan to buy 10 sacks of potatoes.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Elena; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, ella vende en forma ambulatoria diferentes tipos de comida como sopas y menus,la socia también se dedica al negocio de venta de muebles, ella vende muebles los días sabados y domingos en la feria de Tupac Amaru como sillas,mesas,camas y roperos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de comida y ampliar el negocio de venta de muebles. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carne, pollo y verduras y también para comprar muebles como sillas, mesas, roperos y muebles.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Manos Juntas’ (Hands Together) communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.

María Elena, 33, has a spouse and two children.  She alternates her daily chores with a food selling business.  She’s a street vendor of various types of food like soups and daily meals.  She also sells furniture, like chairs, tables, beds and armoires, on Saturday and Sunday at the Tupac Amaru street market.  

She wants to expand the food selling and the furniture selling businesses and is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to cook, like meat, chicken and vegetables, and also to buy furniture like tables, chairs, armoires and furniture.

She is happy about the loan and pledges to make all her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her meal preparations and also to buy furniture.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 37 years old and married with four children, aged between 4 and 18. She runs a spare parts store in Waterloo near Freetown. She also takes care of one relative as well as her immediately ones.

Kadiatu has owned this business for four years and sells engine oil, used tyres and spanners at her store.  Her business is the only source of income she has. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation. 

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more engine oil, used tyres and spanners. Kadiatu says that the extra income from this loan will help improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to expand her business more.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil, used tyres, and spanners.

loans.name: Mignonmide 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MIGNONMIDE 1 est composé de  quatre  personnes qui font ensemble la transformation de noix de palme en huile de palme et de manioc en farine de manioc au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Agnès  est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Agnès  est âgée de 29  ans  et vit au Bénin. Agnès  est mariée à un certain Barthélemy.  Le couple a quatre  enfants qui vivent ensemble avec eux. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Agnès n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Agnès produit depuis sept ans environs, de l'huile de palme qu'elle vend à son domicile. Agnès s’approvisionne en noix de palme dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Agnès sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MIGNONMIDE 1, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Mignonmide 1 group consists of four individuals from Benin who work together  processing palm nuts  into palm oil and manioc [cassava] into manioc flour. The group’s representative, by the name of Agnès, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Agnès is 29 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to Barthélemy. The spouses live together with their four children. Some of the children go to school. Agnès never attended school. In order to provide for herself and he children, since about seven years ago Agnès makes palm oil and sells it out of her home. She stocks up on palm nuts in a town of Benin. In order to satisfy her customers’ needs and to increase her sales volume and he revenues, Agnès, together with other members of the Mignonmide 1 group, is seeking a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Doña Ana Meria, se dedica al comercio de venta de ropa y cosmeticos, con catorce años en las ventas. es madre soltera con dos hijos mayores de los cuales cuenta con el apoyo  economico.
Sus ventas las realiza en un mercado de la capital, en donde alquila un modulo, ha logrado la captacion de clientes, por su variedad y moda de jovenes.
Lleva cuatro ciclos trabajando con la institucion en donde ha aumentado su capital, sus ventas, y sus utilidades. El cual esta sastifecha por su crecimiento ya que tiene sus compromisos de pago, como sus gastos personales.
Con este nuevo prestamo comprara: pantalones de hombre y mujer, shorth, camisas, blusas, camisola, faldas, vestidos, en docenas, esta mercaderia hace el pedido en Guatemala, siendo sus compras mas favorables al comprar a mejor precio, dando a precios accesibles a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana Maria sells clothes and cosmetics, and she has been in sales for 14 years.  She is a single mother, and she has two grown children.  They help her financially.  She makes her sales at a market in the capital.  She rents a unit, and she has managed to get customers because of her variety and fashion for young people.

She has been working with the institution for four cycles.  During that time she has increased her capital, her sales, and her profits.  She is very happy about her growth because she has her payment commitments and her personal expenses.

With this new loan she will buy men’s and women’s pants, shorts, shirts, blouses, camisoles, skirts, and dresses by the dozens.  She orders this merchandise in Guatemala as she can make her purchases for a better price there.  This gives her customers accessible prices.

loans.use: to buy various women's and men's clothes in order for her sales to continue growing.

loans.name: Lidia Marina

texts.es: Doña Lidia es una señora extranjera con 55 años de edad, soltera y trabajadora. Vive con sus hijos y nietos. Reside en Costa Rica hace seis años. Se dedica hace cinco años al comercio ambulante por catálogo de productos amway, debido a que tenía que salir adelante y ayudar en su hogar. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su familia para las ventas y cobros de su negocio. Es una persona con deseos de superación. Se dedica también a la fisioterapia y se caracteriza por su forma de ser al querer ayudar a las demás personas. Es primera vez que solicita financiamiento para su actividad, debido a que ve la urgencia de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en: Doña Lidia, 55, is a foreign lady who is single and hard-working.  She has lived with her children and grandchildren in Costa Rica for six years.  For five years she has been selling Amway products by catalogue in order to get ahead and help with the household expenses.  She has her family's support in sales and payment collection for the business.  She is a person with a great desire to improve her lifestyle.  She also is a physical therapist and known for wanting to help other people.  This is her first request for a loan for her business, since she wants to be able to provide immediate service to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To buy Amway products.

loans.name: Roca De Los Siglos Group

texts.es:
La señora Margarita es casada, tiene 46 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 7 hijos 2 D. los cuales estudian, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y ahora a la crianza D. animales, hasta ahora inicia este trabajo, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

DeciD. organizar un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra D. animales domésticos consistentes en pollos D. engorD. y cerdos, espera en el futuro contar con muchos animales. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza D. animales y el resto a la elaboración D. canastillas D. plástico.
texts.en:
Margarita is 46, and married. She didn't have the opportunity to go to school,. She has seven children, two of whom go to school.  In addition to her  household chores, she now raises animals.  

She is just starting this work, and has the support of her husband who is a shopkeeper. She decided to organize a group in order to apply for a loan. She will use it to buy domestic animals, consisting of broiler chickens and pigs. 

She hopes to have a lot of animals in the future.  Some other members of the group raise animals, and the rest make plastic baskets.

loans.use: To buy chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Alii

texts.en:
Alii is a 35-year-old married man. He has seven children, of whom two are currently enrolled in school. His wife, Mariam, runs a vegetable and fish kiosk. Alii has been employed for the past five years, although he wants to start a meat goat selling business. He states that his highest monthly expenses are food and other household items. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Alii will use the 20,000 Kenya shilling (KES) loan to buy goats for his new business. Alii aspires to open his own fish stall in the future. He joined Yehu because they have many affordable loan products.

loans.use: To buy goats for his new business.

loans.name: Presencia

texts.en: Presencia is 65 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. She has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & coconut wine. She has had this business for 10 years. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & coconut wine.  Presencia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, snacks & coconut wine

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 40 and married to Hamadi. She has five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated an ice-cream selling business, selling at the market and from home to her neighbours and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 15,000 she wants to establish a food stall business, cooking chapatis (flat bread) and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to establish a food stall business, cooking chapatis (flat bread) and beans.

loans.name: Sinoko Farmers Group

texts.en:
Linet is the facilitator of the Sinoko Farmers group. Linet and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Linet and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to ensure food security for her family and to have farm inputs in time for planting. In the recent 2011 season, Linet had an excellent maize yield harvesting 24 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Linet was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from her maize sales, Linet will save for medication for her family members and educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Sinoko Farmers group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Linet with her group members and standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Sol Group

texts.es: La Sra. Amelia  es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar  y  tiene 27 años de edad,  actualmente es socia  en la alcancía comunal “Mujeres del Sol” grupo  conformado por 15  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Amelia trabaja en una bodega donde vende abarrotes, dulces, gaseosas, y lo inauguró hace 8 meses, este trabajo surge a raíz de que su primer hijo entra al colegio por primera vez  y es así su deseo de brindarle lo mejor  a sus hijos  y su deseo de superación de Amelia, Su sueño de Amelia es tener una bodega más grande y  vender al por mayor, Amelia agradece a Edaprospo y kiva por que fue quien le dio su primer prestamo para tener su negocio . Sabemos que Amelia cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Amelia lives with her partner. She has two school-aged children and she is 27 years old.  She is a member of the "Mujeres del Sol" (Women of the Sun) communal bank which has 15 members who have diverse businesses.  

Amelia has a shop where she sells groceries, candy, and soft drinks.  She started her business 8 months ago when her first son started school.  She wants to provide the best to her children and get ahead.  Amelia's dream is to have a larger store and sell wholesale.  She is thankful to Edaprospo and Kiva because they provided her with the first loan for her business.  We know that Amelia will meet her goals with much work and effort, and that the loans from Edaprospo will help her.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, milk, sugar, rice, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa sells plantains and cassavas at Efufu.  She has done this for 5 years now. She is married to a farmer and has 6 dependents. Adjoa uses her income to assist the her husband to provide for their family.

Adjoa will use her loan to purchase more food supplies (plantains and cassavas) for resale.  She will expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: buy plantains and cassavas

loans.name: María Cacimira

texts.es:
La señora Maria tiene 44 años de edad, es casada con cuatro hijos.

Ella desde que era una niña se ha dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura, sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar con especies menores y en la ganadería, esto lo empezó a realizar desde que nació su primer hijo, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. También desde hace siete años que administra su propia tienda en la comunidad donde vive.

La señora Maria, compra cerdos en un tiangue que esta a cuarenta minutos de su casa en autobús, ella se hace acompañar de uno de sus hijos. Ella compra los cerdos, los engorda y luego los vende.

Ella solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar seis cerdos y concentrado para engordarlos, de esta manera podrá venderlos después a mejor precio, que le permita obtener ganancias suficientes para brindarles a sus hijos una vida mejor, brindarles el estudio y lo que necesitan para que tengan un buen desarrollo.

La señora Maria, desea realizar unos arreglos a su vivienda, así como surtir de más productos la tienda que ella tiene en la comunidad, ella manifiesta que todo lo hace para proporcionarles a sus hijos un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria is 44 years old and married with four children.

Since she was a girl, Maria has worked in agriculture. Her parents taught her how to work with young animals and cattle. She started this work after her first son was born, so that she could help with the household expenses. For the last seven years, she has also had her own store in the community where she lives.

Ms. Maria buys pigs at a livestock market that is about 40 minutes by bus from her house. One of her sons accompanies her. She buys pigs, fattens them, and sells them.

She is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy six pigs and feed to fatten them up. This way she can sell them at a better price so she can earn enough to offer her children a better life, an education, and everything they need to develop well.

Ms. Maria would like to make some improvements to her home and to stock more products at her store. She says that everything she does is to provide her children with a better future.

loans.use: to buy six pigs and feed to fatten them up

loans.name: John Alex

texts.en: John Alex is a thirty-eight-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  He has been operating a clinic for two years.  He started with just a pharmaceutical drug shop but later diversified into a clinic.  Inadequate capital to purchase pharmaceutical drugs and necessary equipment is his major challenge.  His dream is to set up another clinic in a new market.  He also hopes to educate his children and build a permanent house.  John Alex needs this loan to buy pharmaceutical drugs to resell.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical drugs to resell.

loans.name: Por Una Vida Digna Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de mujeres  que con entusiasmo y mucha dedicación sale adelante cada día. Así son las integrantes de la alcancía comunal Por un Vida Digna conformado por 6 socias, que tiene un solo objetivo, el de salir adelante sin importar los obstáculos que se les presentan a lo largo de la vida. Tal es a si el caso de la señora Ninfa de 53 años de edad casada y madre de 3 hijos. Que en busca de una mejora económica de su hogar decide abrir una bodega en su casa hace más de 9 años, esta fuente de ingresos le ha generado muchas satisfacciones como son los estudios de sus hijos y la implementación de muebles para su hogar, en conjunto con su esposo a sabido sobresalir y mejorar su estilo de vida y de su familia. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en compras de mercadería. Como la señora Ninfa cada integrante de esta alcancía tiene un historia en particular pero, todas coinciden en un solo objetivo que es el de salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, para el bienestar de sus hogares.
*En la fotografía la Sra. Ninfa se encuentra con una chompa rosada y esta de pie.
texts.en: This is a group of women who, with enthusiasm and much dedication, move forward every day. These are the members of the communal bank "Por un Vida Digna" (For a Dignified Life), which consists of 6 members who have a single goal: to advance in spite of the obstacles that are presented to them in the course of life. This is the case for Señora Ninfa, who is 53 years old, is married, and is the mother of 3 children. In search of a better household economy, she decided to open a grocery store in her house more than 9 years ago. This source of income has generated much satisfaction for her, as have the education of her children and the furnishing of her home. Along with her husband, she has known how to excel and to improve her lifestyle and that of her family. With the current loan, she will invest in the purchase of merchandise. Like Señora Ninfa, each member of this communal bank has a particular story, but all have a single objective, which is to advance with effort and education for the well-being of their households.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Samai

texts.en:
This is 55-year-old Samai. He is Married and has six children, ages 33, 31, 27,19, 11 and 8. He has five additional dependents who live with him as his apprentices. In 1985, Samai established his tailoring business. He began his business because he wanted to engage himself in income generating activity. His business is located at a city center, and his main customers are all classes of customers. 

Working seven days a week and 16 hours a day, he earns about SLL 500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Samai has already received, and successfully repaid, one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy sewing inputs. 

He hopes that this loan shall enable him to buy more inputs for his workshop. In the future, Samai plans to build a house and educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for sewing inputs.

loans.name: Gisèle Berthe

texts.fr: Gisèle est une femme âgée de 45 ans mère de famille. comme activité, elle dispose d'une vente à emporter dans un quartier de la ville de 15 mois. elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. mais son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire toute sa clientèle qui est parfois obligée de se retourner vers la concurrence. Ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital .elle voudrait avec ce crédit pour augmenter les casiers de boissons  afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. cela va également augmenter son chiffre d'affaire ainsi que son bénéfice. Les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de la famille. elle a comme ambitions pour son activité de faire dans la vente en gros des boissons.
texts.en:
Gisèle is a 45-year-old woman and mother. For fifteen month, she has been in business selling beverages to go in one of the city’s neighborhood. She boasts a good amount of experience in her domain, but her capital no longer allows her to meet customer demand, so her clients sometimes have to buy from competitors. This is due to her small capital.

With this loan, she would like to increase her stock of beverages to better meet her clients' needs. This will increase her sales as well as profits. The generated income will make it possible for her to takes better care of her family.

Her ambition for her business is to become a beverage wholesaler.

loans.use: to increase her stock of beverages.

loans.name: Nilda Lohida

texts.es:
Nilda con 42 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su cónyuge y su hijo, en el distrito de Pucará,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de jugos de piña, agua de piña, agua de tamarindo,venta de queques, entre otros, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 3 años.El destino del crédito será para invertir en su negocio, compra de fruta así como invertir en abonos para su cultivo, con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Nilda es socia nueva para Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: para invertir en su negocio, compra de fruta así como invertir en abonos para su cultivo

loans.name: Taloa

texts.en: Taloa owns a two acre land in her village where her plantation is at.  With her $250 loan, she has used it to buy working tools for her business and also school fees for her children. With her taro plantation, she takes them to the market three times a week and also sells them at Salani Surf Resort next to her village. She plans to improve her business by purchasing another acre beside her plantation to start another business which is cattle farming.

loans.use: Business improvement/school fees

loans.name: Shakhla

texts.en:
28-year-old Shakhla is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbacar region, settled in the Khirdalan settlement.
She previously borrowed $400 and bought perfumes. Now she needs a loan of $800 to expand the area of her shop.

loans.use: To expand the area of her shop

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan lives in his uncle’s house, which is located on San Cristóbal Street, in the Bajo Tacagua zone, on the western slope of the city of La Paz. He is 28 years old, married, and has three children. He works in the afternoons for a private television company, but his salary isn’t sufficient to support his family. For this reason he spends his morning making clothing, with help from his wife. They make jackets for other small businesses that subcontract such work. The requested loan will be used to buy a sewing machine so that Juan can do his work under better conditions. Because of his previous good loans with IMPRO, he can take out a new loan without any problems.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan vive en la casa de su tío ubicada en la C. San Cristóbal de la zona de Bajo Tacagua en la ladera Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene 28 años de edad es casado y tiene 3 hijos. Por las tardes trabaja en una empresa privada de televisión, con un pequeño sueldo que le resulta insuficiente para mantener a su familia, por lo cual en las mañanas se dedica a coser prendas de vestir con el apoyo de su esposa, en especial chamarras, que le proporcionan otros microempresarios que se dedican a la confección de las mismas y subcontratan este servicio. El crédito solicita está destinado a la compra de una maquina de coser para efectuar su trabajo en mejores condiciones. Por sus antecedentes en Impro puede acceder a un nuevo crédito, sin problema alguno.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her business

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu K. is thirty years old, married with four children. She runs a business selling vegetables, chili peppers, and beans. Chili pepper is the most important ingredient in every Sierra Leonean food, and farmers earn a good income from growing them.

With her previous loan, Mariatu was able to purchase three bags of chili peppers and sold them within a week. This means a $25 profit every week. Mariatu would like to embark on wholesale activities and is requesting a loan of $200 for that purpose. This will enable her to purchase seven bags of chili peppers per week, so her profits will increase accordingly.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables in bulk for resale

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en: Epifania is a mother of three.  She is 50 years old and is from the village very far from town but married to a man from Faatoia.  Her business is selling BBQ twice a week to the people of the village.  She earns $150.00-$200.00 a week and uses that money for her family expenditures.  She is requesting a loan of $500 to buy supplies for her barbecue business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her barbecue business

loans.name: Rasheedan

texts.en: I am Rasheedan B.. I am married and a mother of six: three girls and three boys. My husband supplies various grocery items such as pulses, spices, detergents, etc. to different shops in the city. Earlier, my husband was very sick and could not work. Therefore, at that time, I started working as a sweeper in various posh houses for meager incomes. With such a small income, I had to take my husband to the doctor and put food on table for my children. I have been through very crucial economic crises. I thank God that my husband has recovered and our business is flourishing. Please lend us $300 to expand our business further. We plan to buy a stock of various grocery items such as spices and pulses. My husband is confident he can offer a secure future to his family.

loans.use: Buy a stock of grocery items

loans.name: Merita

texts.en: Merita is in her late thirties and the mother of four children. The eldest goes to university, and the younger ones are in secondary school. Merita makes a living selling fresh vegetables and legumes.  She has been this business for six years, is well known for her produce and has lots of customers. Merita's long-range goal is to rent a stall where she can sell her goods, because this will allow her to expand her business and make her customers more comfortable. Merita has applied for a loan to buy a large quantity of vegetables to sell, so that she will not need to leave her community to acquire new stock for the next two weeks. Her goal is to increase her income so that her family can live more comfortably and she can pay her son's university tuition.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to restock a small business

loans.name: Maria Claudina Lotes

texts.pt:
Maria Claudina Lotes B. lives with her husband and 5 children in Hulene-Maputo, Mozambique, where she is in the business of selling basic food products and beverages. She just joined the program and plans to use her first loan to increase the market's stock.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Claudina Lotes B., portadora do BI nº 110577944Q, vive maritalmente tem 5 filhos esta a entrar no programa vai tomar o valor de 5000 a pagar em 5 meses o valor é para aplicar no negocio.

loans.use: To buy more food products to sell at her market

loans.name: Emah

texts.en: Emah is 23 years old and married to M.. She and her husband both make bamboo matting for a living. They earn $60.00 a month. Emah is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of $125.00, which she will repay within twelve months. She will use this loan to buy more bamboo.

loans.use: To buy more bamboo

loans.name: Dusu

texts.en: Dusu lives in the village of Kormasilia in Sierra Leone.  Her family's livelihood depends on farming. She received a loan from SMT and used the loan proceeds to hire labour and to purchase fertilizer, which increased the farm's output. Dusu was extremely happy to have harvested 25 bags (50Kg) of pigeon peas after she received the loan from SMT because that output was a significant increase over the roughly 10 bags of peas she harvested before the loan.  After she received the SMT loan, Dusu also harvested 1,080 heads of cabbage and earned a good profit.   She would like to expand her farm and is thus requesting a loan of Le. 1,000,000.

loans.use: To continue to support her family through farming by expanding her farm

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Mrs. Marina lives in her own home with her husband and children on Manuel Jofre Street in the zone of Tacagua in the city of La Paz; she works in an institution where they sell natural medicines and at the same time she has a grocery store that she tends for her mother. The loan that she requests is for the purchase of more merchandise that will help her improve her store and offer a better variety to her clients and generate more income. Her previous history is good and she qualifies for new loans. Marina has been a client of IMPRO since 2005.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Marina vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos en la calle Manuel Jofre de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; ella trabaja en una institución donde vende productos naturales medicinales y a la vez tiene una tienda de abarrotes la cual es atendida por su madre. El crédito que solicita es para comprar más mercadería y poder surtir mejor su negocio y ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes y así poder generar mejores ingresos. Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito. Marina es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2005.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia D. sells sandals and other footwear. She is married and has 3 dependants. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family, so Cecilia is working very hard to help with the family’s expenses. She wishes to increase sales, therefore she is asking for a loan to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr:
A native of Benin, Mrs.Yvette T. was born around 1965 in the town of Drkanme in the Department of Oueme. She is married to Jerome Ahannougbe, and has three children: Diane, 17 years old, is an apprentise dressmaker, José, age 16, is in 10th grade, and Nicole, age 13, is in 9th grade. Mrs.Yvette locally retails red vegetable oil made from the oil palm, corn, bread, and various condiments. In order to strengthen her business, she is asking for a loan with which to buy more products.

Translated from French by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

De nationalité béninoise, dame T. Yvette est née vers 1965 à Dékanmè dans le département de l'OUEME. Elle est mariée à Monsieur AHANNOUGBE Jerôme et mère de 3 enfants: Diane âgée de 17 ans est apprentis couturière, José âgé de 16 ans et en classe de seconde (2nde) et Nicole 13 ans en classe de Troisième (3ème). Elle revend en son domicile de l'huile végétale rouge produite à partir du palmier à huile, du maïs, du pain et divers condiments. Pour renforcer son activité, elle sollicite ce crédit afin de s'approvisionner.

loans.use: Purchase of 5 cans of red vegetable oil, 2 bags of corn, 10 trays of eggs, and 5 boxes of biscuits.

loans.name: Magno

texts.es:
Magno is a farmer and there are seasons, such as during the harvest, when he has to stay on his lands for weeks. During this time he leaves his wife as head of the household, since his fields are far from home. Rafaela, his wife and the person pictured in the photograph, comments that Magno is a wonderful father who tries in every way possible to satisfy the needs of their six children who are pursuing basic level education. With this goal of meeting basic needs in mind, Magno and his wife Rafaela would like to acquire additional land in order to plant peas and obtain income more quickly, since peas are harvested in less time. For this reason they seek a loan, money that will allow them to increase their production and obtain income over shorter time periods. If you are able to help this family get ahead, Magno and his wife would be eternally grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Magno es agricultor y hay temporadas que tiene que permanecer en sus terrenos por semanas, en los días de cosechas, durante ese tiempo deja a su esposa como cabeza de su hogar, ya que sus cultivos están alejados de su casa. Rafaela, su esposa, y a quien se le ve en la foto, comenta que Magno es un gran padre que trata, en lo posible, satisfacer las necesidades de sus 6 hijos quienes cursan estudios básicos.Con esta finalidad, Magno y su esposa Rafaela desean poder adquirir un terreno adicional en donde pueda cultivar alverja y obtener ingresos prontamente, debido a que la arveja se cosecha en menos tiempo.Para ello solicita un préstamo, dinero que le servirá para ampliar su producción y obtener ingresos a corto plazo. Si usted puede ayudar a esta familia a progresar Magno y su esposa se lo agradecerán de por vida.

loans.use: To purchase arable land in order to plant peas.

loans.name: Sandra Elena

texts.es:
Ms. Sandra lives in the neighborhood Hialeah and is 39 years old. She is unmarried and has two sons (ages 11 & 12). Their father helps financially with feeding the children, and Ms. Sandra works as a concierge since 5 years ago.

This loan she is requesting is to purchase a toilet and construction materials to make a bathroom so she and her children can be comfortable in their home.

Her plans are to be able to continue making improvements to their home for her children's sake and also to help them with educational costs.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Sandra habita en el barrio Hialeah y tiene 39 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos hijos de 11 y 12 años de edad, el papá le ayuda con la alimentación de sus hijos. Doña Sandra trabaja desempeñándose como conserje y tiene cinco años laborando. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para la compra de un inodoro y comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un servicio higiénico y así poder estar cómoda con sus hijos. Sus planes son poder seguir haciendo mejoras para en la vivienda para sus hijos y también ayudarles en su preparación educativa.

loans.use: For construction of a bathroom in her home. (Construcción de un servicio higiénico en su vivienda)

loans.name: Félicienne

texts.fr: Dame T. Félicienne est dans la vente d'igname, des oignons et des cossettes d'igname depuis une dizaine d'années. Elle vend également des condimlents aux habitants de son quartier. Elle se rend généralement au  grand marché Tokpa pour ses achats. Elle envisage très prochainement se rendre au nord du pays pour faire de plus importante achats. Agée de 34 ans, elle est originaire de  Savè dans le département des Collines. Elle vient solliciter ce prêt pour renforcer son commerce.
texts.en:
Ms. Félicienne T. has been selling yams, onions, and yam cossettes (sun-dried slices of yams) for a dozen years. She also sells condiments to the residents of her district. She generally goes to the Tokpa marketplace for her purchases. She very soon envisions going up north to make more sizable purchases. She is 34 years old and originally from Savè, in the county of Collines. She has come to request this loan to bolster her commerce.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 100 kg of yams and 2 sacks of onions

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Doña Ana Maria tiene 37 años de edad, habita en el barrio San Caralampio la Concha, es soltera y tiene dos hijos de edad de 5 y 13 años de edad. Doña Ana Maria trabaja en una empresa de la zona franca desempeñándose como operaria, lleva seis años en este puesto. El préstamo que esta solicitando Doña Ana Maria es para hacer mejoras en su vivienda, es para poner piso de cerámica en su vviienda y así lograr que este sea el primer paso para que ella empieze el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana Maria, 37, lives in the San Caralampio la Concha neighborhood. She's a single woman with two children, 5 and 13. She has been working as an operator [machine operator, perhaps?] in a free-trade zone for the last six years. The loan that Ana Maria is applying for will be used to make improvements to her house. It's for installing a tiled floor in the house, a first step she hopes toward making it a better place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install tiled floor.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Ccori Soncco Village Bank, which means “Heart of Gold” in Quechua. Paulina lives with her husband and their four children. She travels to different regional fairs three times per week to sell clothing. She travels to Lima twice per month to buy her wares.
 
Paulina needs a loan of 2000 soles (US$650) to buy sweaters, blankets and jackets. She dreams of expanding her business bit by bit, of opening a clothing store in the city of Ayacucho, and of educating her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco que significa Corazón de Oro en quechua.

Paulina es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos, Paulina viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región tres veces por semana en donde vende ropa, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja 2 veces al mes. 

Paulina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas, mantas, casacas.

Paulina sueña con ampliar poco a poco su negocios, abrir una tienda de ropa en la ciudad de Ayacucho y educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy sweaters, blankets and jackets

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
Mrs. Phen L., 76, is a widow and the mother of one daughter, aged 46, who works with her. Phen L. owns a grocery store at her home where they sell different types of grocery products and food provisions to the people in her area.

She and her daughter started this business in 2001 and can make an income of about $6 to $9 per day. To increase her profit margin, Phen L. is asking for a loan to expand her inventory by adding more products.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to expand her business.

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Zolia

texts.en:
Zoila Arevalo is sixty-one years old and lives in the department capital Pucallpa in the eastern jungle region of Peru.  Zoila’s husband works in construction and together they have five children.  Zoila has been a member of the Talented Women communal bank for six years and she has used the money from her loans to support a food-selling business where she sells chicken and sausage.  She also sells tamales and chicken and rice dishes each night in front of her home.

Zoila is requesting a loan of 3,000 Nuevo Soles to fund her daily purchases of 20 kgs of potatoes, 3 liters of oil, a dozen eggs, and fresh chicken.  She will also purchase gas cans with which she will fuel her stoves.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, liters of oil, eggs, fresh chicken and gas cans of fuel

loans.name: Ni Made Rani

texts.id: Hidup dengan suami dan 1orang anak yang masih balita, tentunya membutuhkan banyak biaya. Begitu juga hal yang dialami oleh Ni Made Rani. Sudah menjadi tradisi wanita di desa, salah satu usaha yang dilakukan untuk menambah perekonomian keluarga adalah beternak babi. Namun yang menjadi kendala adala kurangnya pengetahuan akan beternak babi yang baik dan benar sehingga usaha yang ditekuni tidak menghasilkan dengan maksimal. Sebelumnya, Ni Made Rani hanya memelihara satu babi penggemukkan dan hanya diberi pakan tradisional yang berupa dedaunan dan sisa makanan di dapur. Hal seperti itu menyebabkan pertumbuhan babi tidak optimal dan tentunya berpengaruh terhadap harga jual. Setelah mendapat pembinaan dan pinjaman modal, sekarang Ni Made Rani memelihara 4 ekor babi yang dipisah dalam dua kandang. Hal itu dilakukannya untuk memudahkan perawatan dan pembersihan kandang. Pinjaman itu digunakan juga untuk membeli pakan yang berkwalitas sehingga sekarang pertumbuhan babinya pesat dan sehat. Dengan adanya perubahan cara beternak, hal ini berpengaruh terhadap pendapatan keluarganya, karena sekarang ia dapat menjual babinya dengan harga yang lebih tinggi.
texts.en:
Ni Made Rani and her husband has one toddler. Having a small kid costs some money. Therefore she wants to do something to earn extra income. She wants to be in the business of raising pig. However she doesn't have a lot of knowledge about this area. In the past she tried to raise a pig but because her lack of know how, it didn't turn very well.

She is now received training and guidance from DINARI foundation in this area. She is now having 4 pigs which she raises in 2 separate huts. She also allocates part of the loan money for a better quality pig food so the pigs can grow well.

As she is now raising the pigs in much better way, she is hoping to get optimal result so she can earn additional income for the family.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs and feeds

loans.name: Sary

texts.en: Sary T., 27, (pictured with her niece), is single and resides with sister in the Battambang province. She owns a grocery store, earning around US$5 per day. Her sister stays at home and helps her sell grocery products when needed. Sary T. is asking for a loan to purchase additional grocery products for expanding her store to meet her clients demands.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of grocery products.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en: Miss K. Lillian owns a salon in Mbarara town. She has been running the business for 6 years. She obtained the loan funds to purchase more items for the salon. Lillian is married with one child.

loans.use: To purchase more hair dryers, hair oils and hair steamers

loans.name: Carla Mercedes

texts.es: La Señora Carla Mercedes M. M. tiene 34 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Carla tiene 2 hijos y estudian para ser unos profesionales. La actividad económica de Doña Carla es una pulpería, hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es una pulpería en donde ofrece gran variedad de productos de consumo diario, produciéndose para una mejor búsqueda de ingresos para su familia. Los propósitos de Doña Carla son de seguir adelante con su negocio ya que todo lo que tiene actualmente le ha costado mucho esfuerzo y no lo perdería. Es por eso que Carla solicito ayuda es Fundación León 2000 con el fin de comprar mas productos para su negocio como golosinas, gaseosas, jugos y sardianas aprovechando la temporada de verano. Los sueños de Doña Carla son de ampliar su establecimiento para suministrar su pulpería de una variedad de productos. La cantidad que solicita es de C$14.000 cordobas.
texts.en:
Señora Carla Mercedes M. M. is 34 and married. Doña Carla has two children who are studying to be professionals. She has owned a small grocery store for more than eleven years. She offers a large variety of products for daily consumption so she can provide an income for her family. Her goals are to get ahead with her business since everything she currently has has cost her a lot of effort, and she won't lose it. This is why Carla is requesting the help of Fundación León with the aim of buying more products for her business like candy, soft drinks, and juice to make the most of the summer season. Her dreams are to expand her location to supply her store with a larger variety of products. The amount she is requesting is 14,000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Cerina

texts.en: Cerina is a wine merchant. She sells bottles of wine on a wholesale and retail basis to her customers in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more bottles of wine to sell. She is 54 years old and married with seven children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bottles of wine to sell

loans.name: Aboubacry

texts.fr: ABOUBACRY D. EST NE EN 1964 A THIES .IL EST MARIE ET PERE DE DEUX ENFANTS .IL EST INSTITUTEUR DANS UNE ECOLE PUBLIQUE A THIES .IL EST MEMBRE DE LA MUTUELLE DEPUIS CINQ ANS .IL SOLLICITE CE PRET DANS LE BUT DE SUBVENIR AUX SOINS MEDICAUX DE SA MERE.
texts.en:
Aboubacry D. was born in 1964 in THIES. He is married and the father of two children. He is a school teacher at a public school in THIES and has been a member of the mutuelle for five years. He's requesting this loan with the goal of covering the medical care for his mother.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical expenses

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi has owned a small grocery in the Kihesa neighborhood of Zanzibar for seven years. She belongs to the Dodoma road A group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $125. Every day, she works at her business for four hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania, a Kiva partner, so that she can buy more grocery items to add her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Zawadi is 35 years old, married and has four children: ages 19, 18, 14 and 12. She also cares for four dependents.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to add her current stock

loans.name: Imad

texts.en: Imad is 36 years old, married, and has three children. He owns a small fruit and vegetable shop in the city of Hebron, Palestine. He is requesting a loan of $1,000 that he will use to purchase more fruits and vegetables. Imad and his family greatly appreciate the trust and support that you offer them. Today is the time to help.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Viole

texts.en:
Viole S., 36, is married with five children. She has many years of experience running her general store. She sells to the village community and to the general public seven days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~190 USD). She has six previous loans with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Viole’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a new supply of goods for the shop and also to cover family expenses

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: The photograph shows Mr. Touch S. at work growing fruit on his farm. Touch S. and his wife make their daily revenue by working as local farmers in the village. This couple has given birth to six children: two are married and live separately and the others are single. Two of their are employed as staff and work by sewing clothes in the garment industry. The family owns a medium-sized farm where they plan jackfruit, bananas, and mango trees, but their farm is far from a watering system. Hence, Touch S. is looking for a loan to purchase an irrigating machine to pump water for his fruit crops.

loans.use: To purchase an irrigating machine to pump water for his fruit crops.

loans.name: Teap

texts.en:
Teap R., age 71, is a widow. She lives with her two children in Siem Reap province. To make a living, she has been selling food, mostly roasted chickens and beef, typically earning approximately US $20 per day. The family is also assisted by her two children who are now currently employed with a reasonable income to make a good living.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, R. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, R. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase construction materials in order to build and repair her house. She believes that she will be able to R. her current business at home when her home is convenient enough with the new construction plan she is going to invest in.

loans.use: To purchase wood and construction materials

loans.name: Antiponan

texts.en:
Antiponan R. is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 39 years old. Antiponan is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Antiponan raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting flowers for sale. Antiponan has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Antiponan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antiponan is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Antiponan from HSPFI.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La señora  GLADYS T. E. , tiene 56años, vive en el distrito de LA ESPERANZA , provincia de TRUJILLO, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal ESPERANZA UNIDA.
La empresaria presenta estudios técnicos de corte y confección, refiere que antes de casarse se dedicaba a confeccionar ropa para niños, damas y caballeros , pero al casarse dejó de coser para dedicarse a su hogar.
GLADYS es casada , tiene 5 hijos todos mayores y ninguno depende económicamente de ella.
GLADYS se dedica a  la venta de desayunos y menús en el restaurante de su casa.
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió para comprar utensilios de cocinas, sillas y mesas.
Este crédito de 700 nuevos soles lo utilizará para  comprar productos alimenticios al por mayor como: menestras, arroz, papas ,aceite, azúcar, etc
GLADYS sueña con tener una polleria y así obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Glays is 56 years old and lives in the La Esperanza district, Trujillo province, in the department of La Libertad, Perú.

She is a member of the ESPERANZA UNIDA Village Bank.

This businesswoman teaches cutting and tailoring techniques, something she has been doing since before she was married, making clothing for children, women, and men. When she married she stopped sewing to tend to the household.

Gladys is married and has five older children.

She sells breakfasts and a set menu from the restaurant in her house.

Her first loan of 300 soles was invested in the purchase of new kitchen utensils, chairs, and tables.

This loan of 700 soles will go towards the purchase of wholesale food items such as vegetable stews, rice, potatoes, oil, sugar, etc.

Gladys’ dream is to have a poultry store in order to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase wholesale food products

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine wants to use this loan to buy bunches of bananas. She receives 20 customers a day and works seven days a week. She doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys in the community where she works. The major challenge she faces in her business is seasonal supply.

Justine is a 38 year single woman with three children between the ages of 10 and 18 years old. Justine doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She lives and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. All her children go to school. Justine rents a two room house where she lives with four people. There is no electricity or piped water in her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Justine has with MCDT for five years, now on her fourteenth loan working with the same group mates. Justine hopes to see her business grow bigger and own a permanent business structure.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is here again to ask for financial assistance from KIVA lenders who once helped her with her business through her previous loan. She has been engaged in vending fruits and vegetables in their village for a long time. Her income from vending is being used to sustain her family’s daily needs. She hopes to maintain her business for the welfare of her family. 

Teresita requests a loan of PHP8,000 to use as her additional working capital to purchase more goods to sell. Some of her loan will also be used to sustain the vegetables that she planted in their backyard. It needs fertilizer and other medicines to have a good harvest. She hopes to avail the loan for the development of her business.

Teresita is married to Juanito who is also one of the farmers in their village. They have five children, four of whom are adults already. Their youngest is still attending high school and he is the only one left studying.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell and more fertilizer for her fields

loans.name: Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL CAMINO AL ÉXITO

Rubi D. se dedica a la costura y compostura D. prendas D. vestir, ella empezó capacitándose desD. muy joven,  luego cuando nacieron sus hijos tuvo la necesidad  D. trabajar y colaborar con los gastos familiares, es por ello que puso en práctica lo aprendido, empezó haciendo compostura D. ropa que llevaban a su casa, y tiempo después confeccionando y vendiéndola entre sus familiares y vecinos. La socia ya tiene experiencia en ese rubro es por eso que enseña a sus compañeras para que puedan tener algún ingreso extra para su casa, ella es la presidenta D. la Alcancía Comunal. 
La tesorera es Constantina P. tiene un bazar hace 10 años, ella  comenzó su negocio vendiendo ambulatoriamente, fue muy difícil esa situación hasta que municipalidad les otorgo un terreno donD. podían establecerse todos los ambulantes, fue ahí donD. ella adquirió su puesto y  puso un bazar, negocio que hasta hoy mantiene, pero eso no es todo en lo que ella se desempeña ya que en sus momentos libres Constantina teje bolsos a crochet eso lo aprendió en un mercado donD. compra sus hilos para tejer, hace diferentes tipos D. bolsos que ahora ella y otras personas tienen la oportunidad exportar a México y Venezuela.
Orfelinda tiene su negocio según la estación en verano,  venD. bebidas heladas, pero en invierno venD. chocolate o mates calientes  ella es la secretaria D. grupo.
Todas son responsables y se consideran especiales porque mediante trabajos honrados pueden brindar a sus familias lo necesario,  pero también necesitan el crédito para seguir invirtiendo en sus negocios.
texts.en:
CAMINO AL ÉXITO (Road to Success) COMMUNAL BANK

Rubi D. is engaged in the making and repair of clothing. She began learning this skill at a very young age. Then, when her children were born, it was necessary to work and help with the family expenses; so she put into practice what she had learned. She began making repairs to clothing that was taken to her house and, after some time, began making and selling clothes for her friends and neighbors. Since Rubi already has experience in this field she is teaching other members so that they are able to have extra income for their households. She is the president of the Communal Bank.

The treasurer is Constantina P.. For 10 years, she has had a shop. She began her business selling on an itinerant basis. This was a very difficult situation until the municipality provided an area where all the itinerant businesses could establish themselves. It was there that she acquired a stall and put in her shop, the business that she has operated until now, but that is not all she does. In her free time, Constantina crochets bags.
