She learned this in a market where she brought yarn for weaving. She makes different types of bags, and now she and other persons have the opportunity to export these to Mexico and Venezuela.

Orfelinda operates her business according to the season. In the summer, she sells cold drinks. In the winter she sells hot chocolate or mate. She is the group’s secretary.

All are responsible and consider themselves fortunate because by means of honorable work they can offer their families the necessities of life. They need this loan in order to continue investing in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of products for their businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Amparo Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora AMPARO DEL ROSARIO P. V., tiene 38 años, vive en el distrito de la BUENOS AIRES provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to  de secundaria, es conviviente y  tiene 2 hijas quienes dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica al servicio de corte de cabello, ondulaciones, pintado y tambien hace manicure.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró esmaltes, tijeras y tintes.
Con este crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles comprará cajas de tintes al por mayor para estar abastecida por las  fiestas de fin de año.
Amparo sueña con tener su salon de belleza para así aumentar sus ingresos y poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Señora Amparo Del Rosario P. V. is 38 and lives in the Buenos Aires district in the province of Trujillo in the department of La Libertad in Peru. She is a member of the communal bank, "Mujeres Emprendedoras II" (Enterprising Women II). She studied through her fifth year of secondary school, has a live-in boyfriend, and has 2 daughters who are her economic dependents. She makes a living by cutting hair, doing perms, dying hair, and doing manicures. With her first credit for 300 PEN, she bought nail polish, scissors, and hair dye. With this credit for 500 PEN, she will buy boxes of hair dye wholesale to be supplied for the end-of-year holidays. Amparo dreams about having a beauty salon to be able to increase her income and to be able to offer a better quality of life to her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy boxes of hair dye wholesale

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is married and has 2 children. He is 32 years old. He is a hard-working man who works for long hours so he can put food on the table to feed his family. He is a welder in Agbor, Delta State. 

The problem he is facing is that he is losing his customers because of unreliable electricity. He is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000, to purchase a generator to enable him generate an alternate power supply. He hopes that, with this Kiva loan, he will no longer lose his customers. He says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a generator for his welding business

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario Q. is a 55-year-old woman from Norala, South Cotabato. She has a farm and rice is her main crop. She started farming in 1950 and continues to farm as it is her only source of livelihood. She has five married children.

Rosario is applying for a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to ensure that her plants are well taken care of. She also hopes that the loan will bring her a better harvest and income.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Monica Catalina

texts.es:
El banco comunal Buscando el Éxito esta formado por un grupo de mujeres que buscan  cada día las mejores oportunidades para salir  adelante y tratar de darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias, viven en  Cuenca,  ciudad que tiene una riqueza arquitectónica y obras artísticas que le hicieron merecedora del nombramiento como Patrimonio Cultural del la Humanidad. 

 Mónica A. es socia del banco comunal Buscando el Éxito, ella vive en el Sector de la Empresa Electrica de la Ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 24 años de edad y es madre soltera de dos niñas  7 y 2 años de edad, sus hijas son reconocidas por su padre pero no reciben ninguna ayuda por parte de el por lo que vive en  casa de sus padres.

Ella es comerciante trabaja en la abacería de sus padres ubicada en el mercado 12 de Abril, su horario de trabajo es de lunes a domingo de 7 a.m. a 7 p.m., además se dedica a la venta de ropa americana y productos YANBAL  vendiendo principalemte a sus amigos y familiares a quienes les vista en sus casas o le vienen a ver para realizar los pedidos.

 Lleva 3 años 6 meses trabajando con el banco comunal y fue su mamá la que la incentivó para formar parte de este grupo y nos comenta que los préstamos le han beneficiado mucho para incrementar  su capital de trabajo y con el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue  va a invertir en la compra de ropa americana como pantalones, sacos, blusas, etc.

 Su gran sueño es acabar sus estudios de parvularia para dar clases en una guardería y ser una profesional para no depender de nadie.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Buscando el Éxito” (Seeking Success) was formed by a group of women who search each day for the best opportunities to get ahead and provide their families a better quality of life. The live in Cuenca, a city that has rich architectural and artistic works that have enabled it to become a World Heritage Site.

Mónica A. is a member of the Communal Bank “Buscando el Éxito”. She lives in the Utility District of the city of Cuenca. She is 24 years old and a single mother of two daughters, ages 7 and 2. Her children are acknowledged by their father, but he does not provide support. For this reason, Mónica and her children live with her parents.

She works as a vendor at her parents’ grocery store in the April 12th Market. Mónica works Monday through Sunday from 7am to 7pm. In addition, she sells American clothes and Yanbal beauty products to friends and relatives. She visits them in their homes so that they can view the products and place orders.

Mónica has been working with the Communal Bank for 3½ years after her mother convinced her to join the group. She says the loans have helped to increase her operating capital. This current loan from Fundación ESPOIR will be used to buy American clothes such as pants, coats, blouses, etc. Her greatest dream is to finish her studies so that she can become a professional teacher at a preschool and not depend on anyone.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase American clothing to sell

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.ru: Эмомов Азимджон проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 61 год. Женат, имеет 9 детей. Эмомов Азимджон животноводством занимается более 10 лет. Он откармливает и продает крупно- рогатый скот. Эмомов Азимджон хочет увеличить их количество и получить большую приболь. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
E. Azimjon lives in the Hamadoni region. He's sixty-one years old, married and has nine children. For more than ten years he has bred livestock: fattening and then selling large cattle. E. wants to increase the head count of his herd and earn a profit, so he is requesting a loan to buy more cattle.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Nove

texts.en:
Nove, 35, is living in Surallah, South Cotabato, and has a rice-farming business. He devotes his time to working in his 1-hectare rice field. He heard about Community Economic Ventures, Inc., offering financial support to entrepreneurs like him. He joined CEVI, a Kiva partner, in 2008.

His business is continually growing and now he is requesting a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos. This amount with a low interest charge will be helpful to sustain his business.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Adijat

texts.en: Adijat is a friendly and hard working woman. She designs clothes for her customers. She makes both Nigerian and western designs. Adijat also sells tailoring materials at retail prices to her customers. With these combined businesses, she hopes to support her home. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She is always happy when her customers patronize her stall. She is itching for expansion in her business. She is married with three children. She is 37 years old and her husband works to support their home. She is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Waly Daan 2 Group

texts.fr: Waly  Daan 2 est un groupe de 5 femmes domiciliées  au quartier Noflaye de Bambilor et qui ont la particularité  d’exercer la même activité de vente de légumes, de poissons, de produits de beauté d’hygiène  et de lessive. Pour éviter l’oisiveté et la dépendance  totale ces femmes ont décidé de s’investir dans le commerce afin de pouvoir subvenir a leurs besoins personnels. Ce crédit pourra leur permettre d’augmenter leur part du marche et par conséquent  d’accroitre leurs revenus.
texts.en:
Waly Daan 2 is a group of five women who live in the Noflaye district of Bambilor and who share the particularity of carrying out the same business of selling vegetables, fish, beauty and health products and washing powder. In order to avoid being idle and totally dependent, these women decided to invest in a business in order to be able to provide for their personal needs. This loan will allow them to increase their market share and as a result enhance their income.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening of funds

loans.name: Grecelda

texts.en:
Grecelda B. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 32 years old. Grecelda is married and has 3 school-aged children. Grecelda owns & operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Grecelda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which is about $49 US, every month for these activities.

In 2010, Grecelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grecelda is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Grecelda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family and support education of children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
Fanny E. is a hardworking married woman who sells live chickens and bath soap to earn a living. She uses the profit from her business to raise her big family. She has been in this business for more than three years.

Fanny belongs to a group of young entrepreneurs of Dalig center in Rizal West Branch (RWB). She appreciates that the organization has helped her start and improve her own business, resulting in a better standard of living. 

She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy inventories of chickens and more supplies for her bath soap business. She hopes to have a stall in the market and to buy more inventory in the future for better sales. She sees herself venturing into a full-fledged wholesale business in the next ten years.

With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, Fanny is positive that the family business will continue to flourish, deliver stable profits, and support improvements in her family’s quality of life, bringing them out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy inventories of chicken and more supplies for her bath soap business.

loans.name: Yolotl Group

texts.es:
Esta foto fue tomada en el negocio de la Sra. Adelina P. Martínez, un integrante del grupo Yolotl que significa corazón en el dialecto Náhuatl, que está ubicado en la comunidad de Ajalpan en el Estado de Puebla, México.  En la foto se puede apreciar su local. Ella se dedica a la venta de fruta y verdura que inició hace 2 años. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercancía. Sus clientas dicen que el servicio que reciben de ella es muy amable y entusiasta. También vende servilletas de tela bordadas a mano. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente agradecida con la oportunidad que se le brinda para poder incrementar su negocio.  Tiene 56 años, estudió hasta el cuarto año de primaria, es casada y tiene en total 4 hijos (3 mujeres y  1 varón) los cuales ya cuentan con la mayoría de edad y no dependen de ella económicamente, sin embargo hace algunos años falleció una hija la cual le dejo a su cargo a 3 hijos los cuales ella mantiene económicamente.  Quiere este crédito para comprar en un futuro una caseta o local ambulante mas grande. También espera que con sus ganancias pueda solventar la educación de sus nietos y remodelar su domicilio.

Guadalupe Pérez C. es la presidente del grupo. Tiene 24años, estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria, vive en unión libre y tiene en total 2 hijos (1 mujer y 1 varón).  Ella se dedica a renta de películas que inició hace 3 años. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de un mostrador. 

El grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes. Los otros integrantes son:

Karen P. A.				Vta. De ropa.
Joachin Judith A. P.		Vta. De ropa.
Olga Soledad A. O.			Vta. De cosméticos.
Griselda Edelmira C. Rodríguez		Vta. De medicamento natural.
Elizabeth Alejandra Carreño R.		Cría de aves domésticos.
Mayra P. C.				Vta. De cosméticos.
Noemí Martínez González				Vta. De muebles.
Iris A. P.			Vta. Ganado porcino.
Inés González Juárez				Vta. De accesorios para celular.
María Guadalupe Díaz Méndez			Vta. De tortillas y trastes.
texts.en:
This photo was taken at Adelina P. Martiniez’s business. She is a member of the Yototl group. Yototl means heart in the Náhuatl. The business is located in the Ajalpan community in the state of Puebla in Mexico. In the photo you can appreciate her place of business. She started selling fruit and vegetables two years ago. She is requesting the loan to buy more merchandise. Her customers say that the service they receive from her is very friendly and enthusiastic. She also sells hand embroidered napkins. Upon requesting this loan she feels grateful for the opportunity offered to her to be able to increase her business. She is 56, and she has a fourth grade education. She is married and has four children (three girls and one boy). The children are now grown and are not economically dependent upon her. However, a few years ago one of her daughters died and left three children for her to support. She wants this loan to later buy a larger stall or mobile stand. She also hopes that she will be able to pay for her grandchildren’s education and remodel her house with her earnings. Guadalupe Pérez C. is the president of the group. She is 24 years old, and she attended school until the third year of high school. She is in a common-law marriage, and she has two children (a girl and a boy). Three years ago she started a business renting movies. She is requesting the loan to buy a counter. The group is comprised of 12 members. The members are: Karen P. A.: Sells Clothes Joachin Judith A. P.: Sells Clothes Olga Soledad A. O.: Sells Cosmetics Griselda Edelmira C. Rodríguez: Sells Natural Medicines Elizabeth Alejandra Carreño R.: Raises Poultry Mayra P. C.: Sells Cosmetics Noemí Martínez González: Sells Furniture Iris A. P.: Sells Pigs Inés González Juárez: Sells Accessories for Cell Phones María Guadalupe Díaz Méndez: Sells Tortillas and Cooking Utensils

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

location.town: Comunidad de Ajalpan en el Edo de Puebla

loans.name: Diana Marina

texts.es:
La señora Diana es una madre soltera de 27 años de edad forma parte del banco comunal Dulce Amistad en el cantón Rocafuerte desde hace 4 ciclos,  nuestra socia tiene como actividad un Karaoke en la misma localidad, ya son dos años que está dedicada a su negocio es una mujer independiente de sus padres pese a que es madre soltera ha sabido desenvolverse sola en la vida con su hija de 4 añitos, lo que la motiva a Diana a invertir en este tipo de negocio es que en la localidad no lo había y se mantiene como el único sitio de esta clase para distraerse.

La señora Diana es una persona muy responsable en lo que hace hasta ahora no ha tenido inconveniente alguno con los pagos a la fundación, con los créditos que ha recibido ha ido incrementando su negocio como en sillas, meza, congelador, computadora, mescladora, micrófono, y bebidas, aparte del Karaoke nuestra socia es dueña de un pequeño restaurante donde solo vende almuerzos  de lunes a viernes, y el fin de semana en las noches abre el karaoke, la acompañan a trabajar dos personas que ha contratado, ella nos comentó que la venta de bebidas son altas de 30 a 35 jabas y con el crédito que recibe podrá invertir en ellas y pagar los permisos de funcionamiento del local.
 
Diana es de licenciada en ciencia de la educación además ejercía de psicóloga orientadora de una escuela,  pero al ver que no le sale ningún trabajo sigue con su negocio sin parar, el sueño de ella es poder regresar a dar clases le gusta mucho su profesión, pero no le gustaría cerrar su negocio eso le ayuda mucho económicamente.
texts.en:
Diana, 27, is a single mother and has been a member of Rocafuerte canton’s Dulce Amistad (Sweet Friendship) communal bank for 4 cycles. She’s had a karaoke bar in town for the past two years. Despite being a single mother, she’s independent of her parents and has been her 4-year-old daughter’s sole source of support. This motivates Diana to invest in this business because there is no other like it in town and it is the only place where people can go for amusement. Diana is a very responsible person and to date has had no problem repaying her loans to the foundation. She has used prior loans to provide her business with chairs, tables, a freezer, a computer, a sound mixer, microphone and beverages. Besides the karaoke, she’s also owner of a small eatery where she sells lunches Monday through Friday. On weekends she opens the karaoke bar and she hires two employees to help her. She tells us that beverage sales are very high, between 30-35 cases. She will use the funds to buy them as well as for the locale’s operation permit. Diana is a graduate in Education and also worked as a school psychologist but, since no jobs in her area are forthcoming, she continues non-stop with her business. Her dream is to return to teaching because she likes her profession very much but she wouldn’t like to close her business because it helps her a lot economically.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cases of Colas.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen E. is from the village of Malasin. She is 24 years old. Karen is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Karen owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Karen has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Karen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Karen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Karen is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items in order to expand her store's product offerings. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Karen from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest is 54 years old. He is married with 6 children between the ages of 10 and 26. Four of his children are attending school.

He is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya, where he has been farming for over 20 years. He has two employees on a casual basis. His farm produces milk, tea leaves, maize, bananas, and beans which he sells locally. He is also employed as a teacher and owns a posho mill (a mill that grinds wheat or maize into flour).

His biggest challenges in farming are a poor transport network and lack of experience in dairy farming.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 70000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. He says this loan will improve the health of his family since they will have enough milk for consumption, and it will also generate enough income to enable him to educate his children.

He would like to acquire at least 5 quality dairy cows that produce 15 litres of milk daily. Ernest hopes that Juhudi will continue to support them.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Oasis Del Amor Group

texts.es:
El grupo Oasis del Amor está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Mercedes Amalia Gutiérrez en 1999 inicio vendiendo cosméticos de Avon con el tiempo incursionó en otros rubros como ropa y calzado. Ella es tiene seis hijos de los cuales solo tiene a su cargo a su hijo menor de 20 años y un nieto.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Elena del Carmen F. P. vende ropa usada, cosméticos, realiza nacatamales entre otras cosas y Gedy Adriana Flete D. comercializa ropa usada, nueva, productos Avon y zermat.
texts.en:
The Oasis del Amor group is made up of three hardworking, striving and enterprising women. One of them is Mercedes Amalia Gutiérrez. In 1999 she started selling Avon cosmetics and with time she entered into other areas such as clothes and shoes. She has six children and only the youngest of 20 and a grandson are under her care. The other members of the group are Elena del Carmen F. P., who sells used clothing and cosmetics and makes nacatamales among other things, and Gedy Adriana Flete D., who sells used clothing, and Avon and Zermat products.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing, shoes and cosmetics merchandise.

loans.name: Ilqar

texts.en:
Ilqar A. is a 47-year-old man who is engaged in farming and has been doing this for the last ten years. He is married and has four children.

Ilqar also is a tractor operator but his main income comes from his farming business. His monthly income is 200-300 AZN but this is too low for such a big family. He applied for 800 AZN and he will use this loan to improve the irrigation system of his garden and to purchase two calves.

loans.use: To improve the irrigation system of his garden and purchase two calves

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with grown children. She lives and works in Kahovka, in the south-eastern part of Ukraine. Yelena has been in the clothing sales business for 12 years. Just as many other small entrepreneurs at that time, Yelena started her venture because she didn’t have any other way to provide for her family’s needs. 

Yelena has been successful in this business. She says this venture gives her opportunity to support her family, which makes all the hard work worth the income she is making. This time Yelena is requesting a 10,000 Grivnyas loan to increase the assortment of items she offers. She hopes to increase her income and spend it for her family needs.

loans.use: To increase variety of items to sell

loans.name: Saphina

texts.en: Saphina is 24 years old and has one child, who is seven months old. She is married to a businessman and makes a living by working with him to sell potatoes. She is applying for this loan to increase her income by buying more potatoes to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes to sell to her customers

loans.name: José Alejandro

texts.es: El señor José Alejandro A. P. es una persona muy trabajadora que esta dispuesto a ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. El hace tiempo obtuvo una vivienda de interés social, solo que la barda de la parte de atrás esta muy pequeña y quiere levantarla mas alto; ya que atrás hay mucha hierva y teme que cuando sus niños anden afuera alguna animal les pueda hacer daño. Para realizar su proyecto el requiere de un préstamo para compra el material y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
Mr. José Alejandro A. P. is a very hard working person who is determined to provide his family with a better quality of life. Some time ago he acquired a public housing unit but the rear wall is too short and he wants to make it higher because there are a lot of weeds in the rear and he’s afraid that when his children go out to play some animal that can harm them might be able to get in. To do this project he needs a loan to buy the materials and supplies and to pay labor costs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise a wall.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando G. is from the village of San Francisco, Cauayan City, Isabela. He is 46 years old. Armando is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Armando owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Armando has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Armando joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Armando has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Armando is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Armando from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en:
Johnstone has been practicing mixed farming for the last four years in Kisii town, western Kenya. His mixed farm produces tea, maize, bananas and beans, all of which are sold locally. He also earns income from his matatu (minibus) business, posho mill (a grinding machine that crushes maize into maize flour) and a pension. Johnstone is 59 years old and married with 6 children who are all adults.

He has requested this loan of 80,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a van for transporting farm products to the market. This loan will enable him to reduce the costs of transporting his products to the market. He, however, faces the challenges of diseases which affects his dairy business and dishonest employees. In future, he aspires to expand his dairy farming and transport business and if possible purchase a truck for transport.

He is requesting that Juhudi introduce interest on savings and, if possible, to look for means of coming up with seminars for members.

loans.use: Purchase a van for transporting farm products to the market.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: Aurora tiene 31 años, es casada y vive con sus 6 hijos en su casa propia. Casi toda su vida ha estado ligada a las tareas de la agricultura y la ganadería es por eso que desde hace 5 años empezó a intensificar su actividad en la compra y venta de animales como ovejas, cerdos y becerros de acuerdo al requerimiento del cliente, en el que son ofrecidos en las ferias ganaderas de su zona a un precio mayor. Es por tal razón que procura adquirir animales sanos y de buena raza, eso aumentará la calidad de su capital de trabajo así como de sus ganancias. En adelante desea incrementar su capital de trabajo para vender más cantidad de animales. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de animales menores porque ha visto que también es rentable en sus ventas.
texts.en: Aurora is 31 years old, married and lives with her 6 children in her own home.  For almost her entire life she has been involved in farming crops and livestock.  This is why 5 years ago she began to intensify her work in the buying and selling of animals such as sheep, pigs and calves according to the demand of her customers.  She offers her animals at cattle markets in her area for a higher price.  She tries to acquire healthy, thoroughbred animals which raises the quality of her working capital as well as her profits.  In the future, she wishes to increase her working capital in order to sell more animals.  This is the first loan which she has had with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes being a part of her community bank because all the members are people who she knows.  They are responsible and very supportive.  She thanks those who will fund her loan because it will help her business to move forward.  She intends to use the loan which she is requesting to purchase young animals because she has seen through her sales that this is profitable.

loans.use: Purchase of young animals because she considers this to be more profitable

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita L. is from the village of Brgy. San Nicolas, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 57 years old. Teresita is married and has three grown children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transport in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than seven years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to repair her vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her vehicle for better service

loans.name: Cristhian Antonio

texts.es:
Christian de 34 años, tiene un taller de electricidad. Vive con su esposa (aparece en la foto) e hijos en una zona periurbana ubicada a las afuera de Guayaquil llamada Duran y caracterizada por su ecología de disolución. 

Aprendió en un taller de electricidad donde el maestro y dueño era un chileno quien fue que le enseño todo lo que ahora sale de electricidad. Después que paso el tiempo él se independizo para tener sus propios ingresos. Por esa buena decisión ahora tiene su propio taller con dos ayudantes trabajan desde las 08h00am hasta las 17h00pm todos los días. El hace todo tipo de reparaciones eléctricas en casa y por contratos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción como cemento y arena para poder construir mejor su casa. En el futuro quiere termina de construir su casa y tener dinero para comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Christian is 34 years old and has an electrical workshop.  He lives with his wife (who appears in the photo) and their children in a peri-urban area located on the outskirts of Guayaquil called Duran.  The area is noted for its deteriorating ecosystem.

Christian learned his trade in an electrical workshop.  The teacher and owner was a Chilean who taught him all he now knows about electricity.  After he learned the trade he set up his own business so that he could make his own income.  Owing to this good decision, he now has his own workshop with two assistants where he works from 8.00am to 5.00pm every day.  He makes all sorts of electrical repairs at home and on contracts.

Christian would like to use his loan to buy building materials such as cement and sand so that he can better build his house.  In the future, he would like to finish building his house and have enough money to buy a car.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand

loans.name: Meach

texts.en:
Mr. Meach S. is 63 years old, and he is a villager living in Ampil village, Kandal province. He and his wife are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to cultivate rice for a living. With the farm, they face a problem because they do not have enough money to cultivate it. So Mr. Meach S. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and gasoline for cultivating the rice crop. 

Mr. S. is farmer who works very hard to support their three children: Two are seamstresses in the garment factory and the last one is a student. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers and gasoline for cultivating rice.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng N. is married with four young children living at home in the Kampong Chnang province. She works in a grocery store, typically making US $5 each day. Her husband catches and sells fish. Her husband typically makes about US $2 each day. Heng N. would like a loan of US $600 to purchase more grocery products to sell.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to sell

loans.name: Jovanna

texts.es: Jovanna, de 27 años, vive al lado de sus padres en su casa que es propia.Desde hace dos años, empezó a trabajar de manera independiente, y ha instalado su negocio de venta de comida en un local alquilado. Su madre la apoya en la atención, y ella atiende en su negocio durante todos los días incluyendo los domingos, para vender en mayor cantidad ha desarrollado la estrategia de  hacerles probar a sus clientes las diversas variedades de platillos que ofrece. En las mañanas se abastece de los ingredientes necesarios para  los almuerzos, y una vez terminada la jornada lava todos los platos y cubiertos  para el día siguiente. Manifiesta  que aunque el trabajo es algo agotador, lo considera una distracción y tiene la satisfacción de establecer un negocio con local propio, y ya ha empezado a mejorar la imagen de su local.Es el sexto crédito que tiene con MFP, y esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada formar  parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son responsables y solidarias, además agradece  a todas las  personas que serán gestoras del préstamo solicitado ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Jovanna tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  mejora de su negocio y quiere comprar mesas y gaseosas; además otra parte la invertirá en la adquisición de ingredientes no perecibles al por mayor que siempre utiliza en la preparación de sus comidas, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Jovanna, age 27, lives with her parents in their own house.  Two years ago she started working in an independent manner.  She established her business of selling food at a rented site.  Her mother helps her wait on customers.  She tends to her business every day, including Sundays.  She does this in order to sell more.  She has developed the strategy of having her customers taste the variety of dishes that she sells.

In the mornings she stocks up on the ingredients needed for the lunches.  When she has finished her work day, she washes all of the plates and the cutlery for the next day.  She says that even though the work is somewhat tiring, she feels that it is interesting.  She has the satisfaction of establishing a business at her own site.  She has started to improve the image of her site.

This is her sixth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She has always demonstrated herself to be responsible with her payments.  Also, she is pleased to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive.  She is grateful to all of the people who will be the lenders of the loan she is requesting.  It will be very useful to the progress of her business.

Jovanna plans to use the requested money to improve her business.  She wants to buy tables and soft drinks.  She wants to use part of the loan to get non-perishable ingredients wholesale.  She always uses them in her food preparation.  This is the way she plans to continue making progress.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and chairs to improve her business

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 43 years old, married with five children. Four of his children and two others whom he cares for attend school. His wife helps him in running the business. Samuel sells fruit and he has spent two years in this business. He needs this loan to buy more fruit to sell and he hopes to use the profits that he is anticipating from this business to renovate his house. He wants to sell more fruit in the future.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is the mother of three children and is 40 years old. Her children are between the ages of 3 and 9 years old. Her husband is a lawyer, and all their children are in school.

Rose sells secondhand clothes, and with this business she has been able to buy a piece of land on which she wishes to build a house in the future. Rose is requesting a loan in order to buy more secondhand clothes, and with the profits she wishes to buy even more inventory.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is a 58-year-old widow who supports her family by operating a sari-sari (general) store and a vegetable vending business.  She lives in Narra, Palawan. Miguela joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Miguela has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 to add more products to sell to her customers so that she can continue to save up for the future improvement of her business. Miguela is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more products

loans.name: Delia Constanza

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Atinchik, tiene 67 años, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos.
Delia es docente cesante, se dedica hacer trabajos en crochet, preparación bufetes, tortas y bocaditos para todo tipos de eventos como: matrimonios, bautizos, cumpleaños, entre otros. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos. le gusta Finca porque sin darse cuenta ahorra, su sueño es que su negocio crezca
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the Atinchik Communal Bank, she is 67 years old, she is a single mother and has 2 children.
Delia is a retired teacher; she engages in making crochet crafts and in preparing buffet meals, cakes and sandwiches for every kind of events such as: weddings, christenings, birthdays and many others. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of ingredients. She likes Finca Peru because she can save effortlessly. She wishes for her activity to grow.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her activity.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon, aged 63, is a father of eight.  All his children are now adults save one, aged sixteen, who is still in school. He lives with his family in their hometown of Nkubu in Central Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for over ten years, producing tea, milk, vegetables and maize, which he sells locally. He has always relied on farming for income.

Gideon has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He believes the family will get adequate milk for domestic consumption, and some surplus to generate additional income for other needs. He hopes to acquire two more cows and to make his farming more commercial, however he laments about low market prices and animal diseases, which eat into his farming income.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Perasuna

texts.en:
Perasuna O. S. is 41 years old and married. He is blessed with three children. For the past ten years, Perasuna has been farming his piece of land and he earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES. Perasuna is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD to purchase farm supplies. 

Perasuna hopes to make a profit from his loan that he will use to educate his children. His dreams are to be a prosperous farmer and provide a better life for his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity A. is 25 years old and is currently in the business of selling vegetables.  She will use her loan to stock more vegetables. She is married to a teacher and they have three children but one child does not go to school. Her future goal is to pay for her children's fees.

loans.use: Stock more vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a firewood retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Amalia earns additional income from a sari-sari store and pig fattening. Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of firewood to sell to customers for her Firewood Retailing business. She dreams of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of firewood to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 57, married to Joyce, and a father of five. He has been in farming  in the town of Kikuyu for the last four years, and this is his primary business. 

Daniel has a good credit history with KADET Ltd., this is his ninth loan from KADET and he plans to buy a dairy cow for more milk production. And with any profits, he plans to buy some piglets so that he can invest more for higher returns. 

He hopes to operate a large-scale dairy and pig farm.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Lilybeth

texts.en: Lilybeth is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Lilybeth is making and selling coconut charcoal. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy coconut shells to make coconut charcoal. Lilybeth is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lilybeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconut shells to make coconut charcoal

loans.name: Ricardo Jose

texts.es: Ricardo José tiene 36 años, este no es primer financiamiento que solicita a Fundación León 2000, ya que es por medio de ellos que ha logrado salir adelante. Actualmente el se dedica a la venta de ropa, la ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante, porque es aquí en donde transitan mucho clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas vestidos, trajes y otros. Su deseo es poder seguir teniendo su negocio que es tan necesario para sobrevivir.
texts.en:
Ricardo José is 36 years old. This is not the first time he has requested financing from Fundación León 2000 since it has helped him get ahead. He currently sells clothing as a street vendor because he is in an area where many customers pass through.

The loan he is requesting will be used as operating capital for buying trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses, suits, and other garments. His wish is to continue his business so that he can obtain what he needs to survive.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses, suits, and other garments.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy wood, foam and paint for her fishing boat. Grace has been in this business for 16 years. She earns income from fish vending.

Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy wood, foam and paint for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Agata

texts.en: Agata is 50 years old and married with three children. She has been operating a retail shop for the last two years to make ends meet. She is also employed. In addition, she sells clothes to earn extra income.  Agata is grateful to Faulu Kenya for teaching her communication and interpersonal skills.  This has helped her to increase her clientele.  She wants, in the next five years, to have improved her business and expanded the business premise. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a kiosk.

loans.use: To buy a kiosk

loans.name: Blanca Dayssi

texts.es:
Blanca, es empleada y a la vez vende medicinas, vive con sus dos hijos de 19 y 15 años de edad, tiene 15 años de ser empleada y seis años de vender medicinas, con las dos actividades en paralelo a logrado mantener a sus hijas y darles todo lo necesario.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de medicinas para el negocio, pues quiere aumentar el inventario comprándose pastillas, inyecciones y bebibles, entre ellas analgésicos, vitaminas y antibióticos.
Su objetivo es proveer para su familia todo lo necesario, que sus hijos continúen sus estudios y puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Blanca is employed, and she also sells medicines.  She lives with her two children, ages 19 and 15.  She has been employed for 15 years, and she has been selling medicines for six years.  Through both of these business activities she has managed to support her daughters and to give them everything they need.

She is requesting a loan to buy medicines for the business.  She wants to increase her inventory by purchasing pills, injections, and liquids.  Among the items she will buy are analgesics, vitamins, and antibiotics.  Her objective is to provide her family with everything they need and for her children to continue their education and be able to excel.

loans.use: to buy  pills, injections, and liquid medications for her business.

loans.name: Momodu's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the teachers of the Kulafai Rashideen Primary School in Makeni. Teachers from this institution, like their many counterparts in SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek loans. These loans have proven to be very helpful to salaried workers because they empower recipients to buy or invest in things that their salaries cannot cover. For example, with the help of loans, recipients are able to buy a plot of land, start building a house, buy house-building materials and furniture, or pay school fees for their children. At the end of each month, the group finance officer repays SMT/Kiva on their behalf.

Momodu is the leader of this group of teachers. He is 49 years old and was born in the town of Port Loko. Momodu is married and has 11 children, eight of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. Mododu has served in the teaching profession for 26 years and has joined with his colleagues to request a loan to start a small business. He will use his loan to begin selling school uniforms, exercise books, pencils, pens, and other items. In this way, Momodu will be able to earn additional income to complement his monthly salary.

loans.use: to buy exercise books, school uniforms, pencils, pens, and other items to sell

loans.name: Griselda Veronica

texts.es:
Al negocio de venta de ropa de la señora Griselda le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión.
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar ropa, (para mujer, hombre, niños, y accesorios para bebes).  Ya que sus clientes le están solicitando que tenga a la venta ropa nueva. 
Con este ingreso podrá ayudarle a su esposo el señor Mario, con los gastos familiares y escolares de sus tres hijos que tiene. 
Doña Griselda planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtendrá de su negocio con la inversión de la compra de mercancía. Don Mario es empleado de una agencia aduanal el se encarga de los trámites de exportación, desea ayudar a su esposo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Griselda’s clothing business lacks great variety in the inventory, but she does not have the necessary funds to invest in merchandise. She is requesting a loan to buy clothing for women, men, and children, as well as baby accessories. Griselda already has customers who are asking her to sell new clothes.

With the income she earns, she will be able to help her husband Sr. Mario with the family expenses and the schooling of their three children. Doña Griselda plans to repay the loan with the earnings from her business as a result of investing in more merchandise. Don Mario is an employee of a duty-free agency where he is in charge of export shipments. Griselda wants to help her husband with her business.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more female, male, crape soled shoes.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SILKINCHANY” el banco se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Angostura, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La Sra. es la socia Vanessa, la socia tiene 21 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene  1 hijo de 5 meses de edad, la socia se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores como chanchos, cuyes y aves de corral, la socia también está implementando una tienda de abarrotes, la socia desea invertir el crédito en la implementación de esta su nueva tienda de abarrotes, la socia ha ido comprando algunos productos y le falta comprar muchos más para lo cual requiere el crédito para comprar al por mayor los diferentes productos de abarrotes como harinas, leches, fideos, atunes, azúcar, arroz, entre otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su tienda de abarrotes.
La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Silkinchany" communal bank. The bank is located in the Angostura community, Cusco province, in the Department of Cusco.
This is Sra. Vanessa. She is 21, lives with her partner, and has one 5-month-old child. She raises small animals such as pigs, guinea pigs, and barnyard birds. She is also opening a grocery store. She wants to invest this loan in opening her new grocery store. She has been buying products here and there and she needs to buy many more. To do so, she needs this loan to purchase various products wholesale, such as: flour, milk, pasta, tuna, sugar, rice, and other items.
She needs this loan to open her grocery store.
She is grateful for the support that we are providing and promises to repay her quotas in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to open her grocery store.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy, tiene 28 años y un hijo, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 5 años.
Gladys tiene un Centro de Internet, antes ella vendía fruta, pero vió que en la cuadra donde vive no había Internet y por esa necesidad invirtió en ese negocio, le va bien gracias a las capacitaciones que ha recibido y todo el esfuerzo que ella le ha puesto a su negocio. Con el préstamo que solicita comprará un CPU. Su meta es poder comprar un terreno.
texts.en: Gladys is a member of the “Tarpuy” communal bank.  She’s 28 years old and has a son.  She’s been a member of FINCA Perú for the last five years.  Gladys has an Internet Access center.  She used to sell fruit but she saw that there was no Internet access service on her block and because of the need she invested in that business.  She does well thanks to the training she’s gotten and all the effort she’s put into her business.  She will use the requested loan to buy a CPU.  Her goal is to be able to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy a CPU.

loans.name: Tuleaga

texts.en:
Tuleaga is 38 years old. She is married and has three children. Tuleaga is starting a business venture selling meat products in the local community. Tuleaga needs a loan of 1000 WST to purchase additional meat to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 150 talas or $63 per week) to improve and expand her business.

Tuleaga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Tuleaga's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat to sell.

loans.name: Nazira's Group

texts.en:
Nazira, 34, the treasurer of this group, is a widow raising two teenage children. Having started the business in 2005 with an investment of 5000 soms and the rental of land to sow potatoes and barley, Nazira now owns about 5 hectares of land upon which 4.5 hectares is allotted for wheat cultivation and the remainder for potato production, both crops in high demand. She earns a monthly average of 3000 soms and has been able to purchase all of the needed electrical appliances for her home.

As the end of this year’s farming season approaches, it is time for most farmers to sell their products and repay all debts involved with field work. Nazira plans to spend the loan on paying the tractor driver’s wage and buying fuel. 

 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and to pay for the tractor driver’s services.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 66 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 
Lucita has a souvenir shop that makes & sells flower decorations & wedding souvenirs and decorations. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy materials for making souvenirs & wedding decorations.
Lucita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lucita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for making souvenirs & wedding decorations

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 31-year-old man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for six years. He is faced with limited capital for expansion, inflation and high transportation costs. His personal goal is to educate his children and to build a good house. His business goal is to move his business to a more permanent location. Patrick needs the loan to buy sugar, salt and millet flour for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and millet flour for resale.

loans.name: Sahobiddin

texts.ru: Сахобиддин узнав о возможности получения кредита на расширение животноводства решил тоже получить займ и купить пару молодых коров.Он отец пятерых детей, сам по профессии электрик, но его доходы не хватают на прожиточный минимум , поэтому он занимается скотоводством.Сахобиддин получив кредит искренне благодарен за понимание и финансирование сельской местности.
texts.en: Having learned about an opportunity to obtain a loan to expand his animal husbandry business, Sahobiddin decided to also obtain a loan and purchase a pair of young cows.  He is a father of five children and is an electrician by trade, but his income is not sufficient to cover the cost of living.  This is why he is involved in animal husbandry.  Having obtained the loan, Sahobiddin is genuinely grateful for the understanding and financing for the local rural residents.

loans.use: to purchase two young cows

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal   ”LOS ANGELES”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia;  La socia tiene 43 años de edad, La socia es casada, La socia tiene 3 hijos de 25, 19, 10 años de edad; La socia se dedica al comercio minorista de  compra y venta de frutas la socia tiene el negocio de venta de frutas en forma independiente en uno de los mercados de la ciudad, la socia tiene sus propios proveedores de abastos y ella compra la fruta semanalmente y le traen cada semana para que la socia las venda, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de frutas.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This is a member of the communal bank "Los Angeles."  This bank is located in the Huanchac district of the province and department of Cusco.

This member is 43 years old, married, and has 3 children age 25, 19 and 10.  She has a retail trade business buying and selling fruit.  She works independently in one of the markets in the city.  She has her own suppliers; she buys fruit each week and brings it to sell.  At this time she wants to invest a loan in the purchase of fruit.  

She is grateful for this loan, and promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio is 49 years old and is a married man with eleven children between the ages of 11 and 30.

Bonifacio is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. He has been growing and selling rice for ten years. He works hard to improve his income and support his big family. 

He plans to use his loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. Bonifacio hopes his business will grow. He also hopes for his family to be in good health always.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Yomaira Susana

texts.es:
Yomaira es una joven emprendedora de 23 años. Aunque únicamente ha cursado la educación primaria ella tiene su propio negocio desde hace 4 años. Vive junto a su hermana menor en la parroquia de "Río Verde" en Santo Domingo que es una de las ciudades más jóvenes del Ecuador, actualmente se ha constituido en el punto de enlace entre las región Sierra y Costa del país. Es un sitio privilegiado, no solo por la riqueza étnica, sino también por los paisajes que se pueden encontrar desde el ingreso mismo a esta bella ciudad. Santo Domingo de los Colorados pertenece actualmente a la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, recientemente conformada.  La fiesta principal de Santo Domingo, se celebra con un movimiento intenso de visitantes, intercambio comercial y cultural. Una gran feria tiene lugar en las instalaciones de la Asociación de Ganaderos, allí se muestran y compiten los mejores ejemplares de las distintas razas y cruces que son criados en las haciendas de la región. 

Esta jovencita es dueña de un local de víveres y abarrotes en el centro de la ciudad, trabaja 10 horas al día y le ayuda su hermana menor. Ella desea crecer en su negocio por lo cual se valdrá de un crédito para lograr su objetivo. Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución que servirá de intermediaria para canalizar su crédito ha evaluado a Yomaira y ha determinado que es un cliente sólido. Se le brindará capacitación y asesoría para que ella pueda seguir progresando como empresaria y como ser humano.

Como toda jovencita, su sueño es tener su casa propia y su auto; sabemos que lo logrará en un futuro quizás no muy lejano como premio a su esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Yomaira is an enterprising young woman who is 23 years old.  Although she only completed her primary education, she has owned her own business for four years.  She lives together with her younger sister in Río Verde parish, in Santo Domingo.  This is one of the newest cities in Ecuador.  It has become a key city linking the mountains and the coastal area of the country.  It is a privileged place, not only because of its ethnic riches but also because of the scenery that can be found right from the point of entry of this beautiful city.  Santo Domingo de los Colorados is currently part of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas (a recently formed province).  The main fiesta of Santo Domingo is celebrated with a lot of visitors and a lot of commercial and cultural exchange.  A large cattle market takes place in the Farmers' Association facilities.  There people show and compete with the best specimens of different races and crossbreeds which are raised on the region's farms.

This young lady owns a grocery store in the city center.  She works 10 hours a day and her younger sister helps her out.  She would like to grow her business and will take out a loan so that she can achieve her goal.  Fundación Alternativa is the institution which will serve as an intermediary and channel the loan to her.  They have evaluated Yomaira and have determined her to be a solid client.  Yomaira will be given training and advice so that she can continue making progress as a businesswoman and as a human being.

In common with all young women, Yomaira's dream is to own her own home and a car.  We know that she will achieve this, perhaps in the not-so-distant future, as a result of her hard work.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and make improvements to her premises

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: On September 1 1965, Daniel was discharged from the Guatemalan Army. On that day, when his platoon and he where traveling via military truck, they were ambushed by the guerrillas using incendiary grenades causing severe burn burns. Mr. Daniel received primary care in the army, but was left with residual burn deformity that limits the function and movement of his neck, lower lip and hand due to  burn contractures. This loan will be used for corrective plastic reconstructive surgery to improve his mobility.

loans.use: to improve the motion of his neck, lip and hand

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Ilham is 32 years old; she lives in Nablus City with her large size family. She is a mother of eight children. One year ago, she started selling birds; it’s a good business, but still needs a lot of improvement.

She applied for this loan to buy different kinds of birds per customer requests, plus cages and food for them, which will increase her income, helping her to improve the financial conditions of her family.

Ilham is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success in her business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of birds per customer requests.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería comercial, a través de la cual quiere poder ayudar a sus seres queridos a las personas que necesiten de ella.
Comenta que viene de una persona de familia muy trabajadora y humilde, ella se esfuerza mucho para poder ser una buena profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder parar sus gastos de universidad como ser cuotas y gastos de transporte.

loans.use: Pagar cuotas de universidad y gastos de transporte.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria P. was born in Guayaquil, Ecuador and is 39 years old. She divorced but later remarried a very supportive husband, with whom she had two children. Together they are homeowners. Gloria runs a thriving construction supply store – look out Home Depot! Her shop is located in the large market called Municipal Cinco Esquina. Ms. P. has 15 years of experience selling home construction materials, but she has only been selling in the Municipal for the last two years. Her husband helps her purchase the wholesale goods from large manufacturers. Without him Gloria could not run her business. From 6 a.m. until 5 p.m. these two entrepreneurs work together to sell materials to locals who are constantly making home improvements. She is asking for $1,200 to buy a variety of quality products that her clients ask for. Like most other Mifex borrowers, Gloria will be able to buy a higher quantity of goods if she can purchase supplies in cash because of the discounts. She wants to continue growing her business and is hoping that the kind lenders who see her profile will “invest” in her future.

loans.use: Gloria is asking for $1200 so that she can start carrying quality home supply products and tools for refining the finished products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand furniture business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria V. D. V. is a single mother with five children - the oldest is 15 and the youngest is 7. They live in a barrio called La 41 in the municipality of Consuelo, about two hours northeast of the Dominican capital, Santo Domingo. She payed off her first loan from Esperanza after opening up a small grocery store that sold food and various household necessities.

This loan she is requesting will allow her to expand her business and increase her capital investments to become more self sustainable. Rosisert Reyes, Maria's loan adviser, says Maria had very little before she started her business. With this loan, her business will be more prosperous.

NOTE: This $850 loan will go to fund Maria's business, as well as four other businesses within her solidarity group. They have gone through Esperanza's business training program and will receive shares of this $850 loan to invest in their respective businesses and pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be made. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the success and struggles of the other members in their group.

loans.use: Purchase, flour, sugar, dried milk, bread, gasoline, soap, butter, bread and sauses among various household items

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Adama T. is married with three children. She started a firewood business five years ago but found that it could not generate enough income to support her family because she had insufficient capital.

With her previous loan, she was able to expand her business into tie-and-dye pattern making on textiles and would like to use this loan to enhance her tie-and-dye production capacity. Adama works with her husband, whose teacher salary is not enough to meet their family’s expenses. She therefore supports her husband and family by helping to run their firewood and now tie-and-dye business.

loans.use: To raise tie-and-dye design production

loans.name: Sergio Ramon

texts.en: I have a small store of used clothes. With this business I support my family and pay the school fees for my children. I have had this business for 10 years in the city of Comayaguela. This is a good location because I have very good clients, people of very low resources who cannot go to buy new clothes. I sell: shirts jeans, shorts, sweaters, pajamas, blouses, dresses. At this moment I need to buy clothes because I do not have a lot of product in stock.

loans.use: Purchase bales of used clothes

loans.name: Nim

texts.en: Mrs. Nim N., age 31, sells vegetables along the roadside, earning about $3 each day. Her husband is a construction foreman and earns about $5 each day. They have two children who are students and live at home. Mrs. Nim would like to request this loan of $800 to purchase construction tools to help expand her husband’s business and thus increase her family’s income to finance their children’s education. She is pictured with her husband and children in the photograph.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en: Oscar is a 31-year-old trained clinical officer. He is married, and lives with his wife and 1 child in Chuka Kenya. Oscar, who qualified for clinical work in the year in 2000, worked with Consolata Cottage Clinic, in Chuka, three and half years. On the first of September 2005 he opened his own clinic, Chuka Medical clinic. His clinic is located in the middle of town and offers a range of health services including general curative, family planning, maternal and child health services and also has pharmacy, and a laboratory. The clients appreciate the quality of services provided at his facility. Oscar, who has received one previous loan from KMET, requires US $1200 to further expand his clinic.

loans.use: Clinic expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock of used clothes.

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en: Vahid C. is 35 years old. He is married with three children. He owns and operates an iron door repair shop in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Almost all homes in Azerbaijan are surrounded by a masonry block wall with an iron door. Vahid has been working in this occupation for the last 12 years. He is currently looking for funding so that he can purchase a new lathe for his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase a new lathe for his shop.

loans.name: Aman Allah

texts.en: Aman Allah lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single. Aman Allah has a metal shop. He has been working in this business for more than 3 years. He is very hard worker and he wants to enlarge his business, so he wants to take an individual loan to increase his inventory. He hopes to become better able to make good income to help his family and make a better future for himself.

loans.use: To buy inventory for his metal shop

loans.name: Marla Maria

texts.en:
Mrs. Marla is 37 years old, married and has three children 9, 6 and 2 years old. Her husband works as a Taxi driver.

Three years ago she opened a convenience store offering a variety of groceries, deli and other products like toilet paper, tooth paste, etc. Her husband is her support and together they work hard to offer their family food and education.This business has helped them through difficult times, especially four months ago when her husband had and accident and was not working for a period of time. Due to this difficult situation they couldn’t increase their convenience store inventory and would like to request a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Marla es una mujer joven de 37 años de edad que vive en Laureles Norte, es casada y su esposo trabaja en un Taxi propio, junto han sacado adelante a sus 3 hijos pequeños de 9,6 y 2 años de edad. Desde hace 3 años tiene un Pulpería en la cual vende a su comunidad alimentos como lácteos, enlatados, otros productos como papel higiénico, pasta dental etc. Su esposo es su Principal apoyo, juntos garantizan la educación y alimentación de sus hijos, gracias a la pulpería lograron superar una época difícil que tuvieron hace cuatro meses ya que su esposo se accidentó y estuvo un tiempo sin trabajar, pero los gastos evitaron ampliar su inventario por lo que solicita un crédito para comprar productos y capitalizar mejor su pulpería.

loans.use: To acquire inventory for their convenience store

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
This client is a woman who has dedicated much of her life to farming. She’s a 56-year-old married mother -- both her children are minors and are in school and her husband is a farmer.

Juana hopes that with her efforts and those of her husband, her children will one day get an education. She and her husband dream of one day enlarging their parcels of land, to increase production and that way augment their income, which will help them guarantee a higher standard of living.

The loan that Juana is requesting will be invested in the purchase of agricultural products for the maintenance of the crop.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Esta clienta es una persona que se ha dedicado desde hace mucho tiempo a la agricultura, tiene 56 años, es casada, sus hijos son menores de edad, ambos estudian y su esposo al igual que ella es un agricultor.

Doña juana espera que con sus esfuerzos y el de su esposo un dia sus hijos puedan prepararse, ella y su esposo sueñan con un dia aumentar sus parcelas de tierra para incrementar su produccion y de esa manera aumentar sus utilidades que les ayudara a garantizar un mejor nivel de vida.

El prestamo que esta solicitando doña juana seran invertidos en la compra de insumos agricolas para mantenimiento del cultivo.

loans.use: Compra de insumos Agricolas

loans.name: Kokoli Afiwa

texts.fr:
Y. Kokoli Afiwa, age 62, is a jovial woman, married, and the mother of four. All by herself, she provides for her three children's needs and those of her husband, since he is retired. She operates a shop, "Chez Maman" in Kuma, a small village in the mountains near Kpalimé, one of the largest cities in Togo. She sell various goods, and she uses solar energy to illuminate her merchandise at night. She wishes to use these Kiva funds to increase the capacity of her enterprise by buying flip-flop sandals, canned foods, soap, and other items for retail sale. She hopes to continue to improve her family's quality of life with the profits she is going to make selling her goods

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Y. Kokoli Afiwa est une femme joviale âgée de 62 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle subvient toute seule aux besoins de ses 3 enfants et ceux de son mari étant donné que ce dernier est en retraite. Elle opère une boutique, « Chez Maman», à Kuma, un petit village dans les montagnes environnantes de Kpalimé, une des plus grandes villes du Togo. Elle vend les produits variés et elle utilise l’énergie solaire pour éclairer ses marchandises pendant la nuit. Maman souhaite avec les fonds de Kiva augmenter la capacité de son entreprise en achetant les sandalettes, les boites de conserves, du savon et les autres produits pour revendre. Elle espère continuer améliorer la qualité de vie de sa famille par les profits qu’elle va dégager dans la vente de ses marchandises.

loans.use: To increase the capacity of her enterprise

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr:
Born on May 1, 1954 in Cotonou, Benin’s economic capital, Mrs. Elisabeth Z. is the mother of four children, two of whom are deceased. Her two surviving children are aged 30 and 27. She has been living in the Yagbe neighborhood for seven years, where she runs a business selling pagnes (colorful African cloth) and other products. This has enabled her to attract a lot of customers to the extent that she is no longer able to satisfy them because of lack of funds. For this reason she took out a first loan in 2006 of CFA 40,000 in order to strengthen her business. The experience was beneficial as she was able to meet all the demand. Mrs. Elisabeth now plans to start a restaurant business. However, the capital to which she has access is vastly insufficient and for this reason she is requesting her fifth loan in order to achieve her goals.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 1er mai 1954 à COTONOU dans la capitale économique du BENIN, dame Z. Elisabeth est mère de quatre enfants dont deux décédés. Ses deux enfants vivants sont respectivement âgés de 30ans et de 27ans. Installée au quartier YAGBE depuis sept ans où elle exerce son activité de vente de pagne et des produits divers. Ceci lui a permis de s’attirer beaucoup de clients à telle enseigne qu’elle n’arrivait plus à les satisfaire tous faute de moyens. C’est ainsi qu’elle vint contracter en 2006 un premier prêt de 40.000fcfa afin de renforcer son commerce. L’expérience lui fut profitable car elle pouvait faire face à toutes les demandes. Actuellement, dame Elisabeth projette de se lancer dans la restauration. Mais le capital dont elle dispose est très insuffisant et pour ce faire elle sollicite son 5ème prêt afin d’atteindre ses objectifs.
