loans.name: Paulita

texts.es: Paulita es una mujer muy emprendedora que a pesar de la situación económica que esta en el país, cuenta con su negocio de venta de ropa usada de buena calidad que ofrece a sus amistades y vecinos aun bajo precio. Paulita es madre de dos pequeños a los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida por tal motivo  opto por dedicarse al negocio que instala solo los fines de semana con el fin de no descuidar a su familia y quehaceres del hogar. El negocio ha permanecido 8 años por la atención que ofrece y amabilidad al atender a sus clientes, esta es parte de su fuente de ingresos a parte la que su esposo gana por trabajar en maquiladora. Para que el negocio siga generando ingresos necesita comprar mercancía de temporada.
texts.en: Paulita is a very enterprising woman who, despite the economic situation in the country, has a business selling good quality used clothing that she offers to her friends and neighbors at an even lower price. Paulita is the mother of two little ones who wants to provide them a better quality of life.  For that reason, she chooses to have a business that operates only on weekends in order not to neglect her family and household chores. The business has been operating for 8 years because of the care and kindness she offers to serve her customers.  This business is part of their source of income apart from what her ​​husband earns working in a factory. In order for the business to continue generating income, she needs to purchase seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio de 39 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Julio desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, el cual es apropiado y amplio, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo los ofrece en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtiene buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos diarios de su hogar.  También cuenta con sus tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón y una vez que cosecha lo comercializa a un buen precio en los diferentes mercados.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1800 nuevos soles para compra de alimento balanceado y de fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo, con los ingresos que obtenega puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Julio es un hombre trabajador y responsable que lo único que quiere es que sus hijos se superen y  mejorar económicamente para brindarles estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Julio, 39, lives with his wife and children in his own home, which lacks basic utilities and is located in a rural area in Tambogrande in the department of Piura.  This area is known for its agriculture and livestock activities and it handicrafts.

For a number of years Julio has been raising and selling sheep.  His corral is located in the back of his house, and is well equipped and expansive.  He feeds his animals with nutritionally balanced animal feed and pasture grass.  Once his animals reach an optimal size, he offers them for sale in the different markets in the area, and in this way obtains good earnings to pay his daily household expenses.  In addition, he has some land where he cultivates lemons, and when he harvests the lemons he sells them for a good price in the different markets.

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1,800 Peruvian soles to buy balanced animal feed and fertilizers to improve the land that he cultivates.  With the income that he will earn he will pay off the loan and improve the quality of life of his family.  Julio is a hardworking and responsible man who only wants his children to do well in life; he wants to improve his finances so that he can provide them with a college education.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizers to improve his farmlands

loans.name: Beatriz Adriana

texts.es: Beatriz es madre soltera de 3 hijos y se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, artículos para el hogar y calzado nuevo por catalogo, al verse ella con la responsabilidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos con las necesidades básicas, alimentación, calzado,  vestido, educación emprendió un negocio que le permitiera atender a sus 3 hijos y al mismo tiempo proveerlos de  lo necesario para que pudieran vivir bien y así fue como desde 4 años este negocio ha sido su única fuente de ingresos; ella quiere comprar mas artículos de segunda mano para invertirle a su negocio y con las ganancias que ella saque incrementar los productos para su venta y al mismo tiempo mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Beatriz is a single mother with 3 children who sells used clothing and new home furnishings and footwear by catalogue. Faced with the responsibility of supporting her children and providing them with basic necessities such as food, shoes, clothing and an education, she started a business that would allow her to take care of her 3 children and at the same time provide them with what they needed to get ahead. For the past 4 years this business has been her only source of income. She wants to buy more second hand clothing in order to invest in her business. With her profits she will increase the quantity of goods for sale and at the same time improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a married man with three children. One of his children attends school while two are still young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and transport costs.

For the past three years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa vive por la parroquia de Quinta Chica en la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales, agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades económicas, son personas muy amables y gentiles.

La Señora Rosa tiene 30 años, es casada y fruto de esa unión ha concebido un hijo de 4 años de edad. Su esposo es empleado privado y no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa, esta actividad  la realiza hace algún tiempo y vende en los días de ferias.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de  camisetas, pantalones, blusas y ropa de niños para surtir más su negocio.
 
Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in Quinta Chica Parish in the city of Cuenca.  Its residents are merchants, raise livestock and farm.  Many work in the city in various jobs.  They are kind and charming people.

Rosa, 30, is married and has a four-year-old son.  Her husband is a private employee and they do not own a house; they rent.  

She sells all sorts of clothes.  She’s been in this line of work for some time now selling on market days.

She’s in her second loan with the communal bank and she’ll use it to buy shirts, pants, blouses and children’s clothes to stock her business more.  Her goal is to own a house.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 41 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children; 2 are currently in school. For the past 7 years, Jessica has been working hard to manage her small boutique, which sells clothes and beauty supplies. 

To help expand her business, Jessica has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a roll of second-hand clothes, and will help Jessica to generate greater profits and improve the standards of living for her family. Jessica hopes that in the future she will be able to continue to grow her business. 

Jessica is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jessica who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase a roll of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 39 años, es una mujer valiente y muy trabajadora, ella es madre soltera de dos hijos de once y seis años, vive en un casa alquilada junto a su hermano con quien comparten los gastos del hogar. Su trabajo  consiste en le venta al por menor de productos de primera necesidad, por tanto posee una tienda donde expende estos productos, asimismo vende helados, gaseosas, raspadillas, bebidas alcohólicas, hasta realiza recarga de línea para celulares. Su negocio es muy variado y es la más grade de la cuadra, y por tal es la más concurrida ya que los clientes encuentran de todo ahí. Este trabajo lo realiza sola, mientras sus hijos están en el colegio, pero cuando no tienen nada que hacer, la mayor la apoyan en la atención de la clientela. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para poder realizar muchas actividades más, ya que vende algunos productos por catálogos en su tiempo libre. Le esta yendo bien y sus ganancias son buenas, espera poder ampliar mas adelante su negocio. Este será el segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Esta muy agradecida con la institución ya que le dan la oportunidad de poder crecer con su inversión. Con el monto solicitado, comprará mercadería para abastecer su tienda, pues le esta faltando arroz, azúcar, verduras y algunos otros productos que si compra en cantidad gasta menos en pasaje y le dan a un menor costo.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 39 years old. She is a brave and hard working woman. Elizabeth is a single mother of two children, aged 11 and 6. She lives in a rented house with her brother who splits the expenses with her. Her works consists of the retail sale of essentials, therefore she has a store where she sells these products, as well as ice cream, soft drinks, snow cones, and alcoholic beverages; she even sells minutes for prepaid cellphones. Her business is very varied and is the largest on the block; for this reason, it’s the most popular store because customers find everything there.

She works alone, while her children are in school, but when they don’t have anything to do, her oldest daughter helps her wait on customers. What she likes most about her work is that she has time to do many other things, as she also sells some products via catalog in her free time. Things are going well and her income is good. She hopes to expand her business farther. This will be her second loan with MFP, therefore, she hopes for the support of each one of you. She is very pleased with MFP since with their investment, they give her the opportunity to be able to grow. With the amount requested, she will buy merchandise to stock her store, because she needs rice, sugar, vegetables and some other items. If she buys these in bulk, she will spend less on transportation and will be given a better price.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, vegetables and other canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase carpentry materials.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 39 years old, married and mother of eight children.

Sanaa has been an owner of a weaving workshop since 2003. She learned this trade from her mother. She has a good reputation and has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. She is becoming well known in the surrounding areas.

She decided to apply for this loan of $1200 in order to purchase a split air conditioner and a generator for her workshop. She is aiming to get more profits to allow her to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a split air conditioner and generator for her workshop.

loans.name: Yarn

texts.en:
Yarn, 29, is married and resides with her husband and child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean sites. 

Yarn is employed at a garment factory, and her husband is a construction worker. This couple works so hard every day for incomes to help cover the family expenses. 

Yarn is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to commute to work. By doing so, she will save on transportation costs. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: Mangule

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 2  filhos dos quais um ainda frequenta a Escola. Fez a 7ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É cabelereira ha mais de 15 anos e dona do salão e tem um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria(BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa(chapas, areia, cimento, pedra,  e outros).Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 7.000.00mt, 8.000.00mt, 13.000.00mt, e 13.000.00mt,todos para habitação.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende terminar a obra da sua casa e construir uma Pastelaria para aumentar o seu rendimento, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Mangule was born in the District of Boane, in the Province of Maputo in the South of Mozambique. She’s single and the mother of 2 children, one of whom still attends School. She completed 4th grade and didn’t continue her education due to her parents’ lack of financial means. She lives in her own house with her family and doesn’t support anyone else.

Mangule has been a hairdresser for more than 15 years, as well as the owner of a salon and has a monthly income of around 5,000.00 meticals (MZN) which she spends on household expenditures and saves in her bank account (BIM).

She has never had loans from other banks and she came to know Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her fifth loan from Hluvuku, for 20,000.00 MZN, with which she intends to purchase construction materials to continue the build of her home (plates, sand, cement, stone and others). Her first loans were for: 7,000.00 MZN, 8,000.00 MZN, 13,000.00 MZN and 13,000.00 MZN, all of which she used for her house.

Mangule commits to paying off her loan and in the future intends to complete the construction of her home and build a cake & pastry shop in order to increase her income. To this end, she expects to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: purchase construction materials to continue the build of her home (plates, sand, cement, stone and others)

loans.name: Lutacho No.7 A Group

texts.en:
Agnes is the facilitator of the Lutacho No.7 A group. Agnes and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Agnes and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Agnes had a very good maize yield harvesting 21 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Agnes was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Agnes will invest in livestock rearing and send her children to school.

In 2012, the members of Lutacho No.7 A group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Agnes with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Perseverantes Group

texts.es:
Las Perseverantes es un grupo que esta integrado por 11 mujeres muy unidas y trabajadoras cada una de ellas realiza una actividad económica para sacar a delante a sus familias y tener una mejor calidad de vida.Este grupo esta ubicado en una región donde hay muchas huleras (muchos arboles de hule) y como el clima es fresco se cosecha el café y la naranja.

Reyna es uno de los miembros de este grupo, ella tiene la edad de 25 años, estudio una carrera en sistemas computacionales y es soltera, Reyna nos platica que hace unos meses con el apoyo de su familia abrió un CiberCafe en un local que tiene en su hogar en el cual todos los días de ocho de la mañana a ocho de la noche brinda el servicio a sus clientes de renta de computadoras, impresiones y la elaboración de trabajos, También nos platica que los fines de semana imparte cursos a los niños y jóvenes de su comunidad.

Ella dice que Trabaja muy a gusto en su negocio y que le deja buenas ganancias ya que es el unico cibercafe de la comunidad.

Reyna necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de una computadora, tinta y hojas blancas para continuar trabajando en su negocio.

Ella platica que todos los días pone muchas ganas a su trabajo ya que desea que siga creciendo poco a poco.

Los demas integrantes del grupo son:

Adilene venta de zapatos 
Agueda venta de plasticos
Maria Concepcion venta de dulces
Carmela venta de trastes de platico 
rosa Angela venta de antojitos
Loyda club nutricional
Maria Cohinta venta de papeleria
Victoria venta de reposteria 
Agueda venta de calzado 
MAtilde tienda de ropa
texts.en:
Las Perseverantes has 11 members, all hard-working women, who operate various businesses that help support their families and improve their quality of life.  The members live in a rubber-producing area (surrounded by rubber trees).  The climate is mild and suitable for growing coffee and oranges.

Reyna, 25, is a member of the group.  She is single and has a computer systems background.  She tells us that, with help from her family, she started an Internet cafe several months ago.  She operates the business from a space in her house and works every day from 8:00 in the morning to 8:00 at night.  She sells computer and copier services.  She adds that she provides tutorials for teens and children at weekends.

Reyna says that her Internet cafe is the only one in town and that the business is doing very well.

Reyna will use this loan to buy a computer, ink and paper for the business.

She adds that she enjoys the work because she wants to continue growing her business.

The other members of the group are:

Adilene: shoe sales.
Agueda: plastic sales.
Maria Concepcion: snack sales.
Carmela: plastic flower sales.
Angela: snack sales.
Loyda: vitamin sales.
Maria Cohinta: school-supply sales.
Victoria: pastry sales.
Agueda: footwear sales.
Matilde: clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy a computer and other supplies for her Internet cafe.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 38 years old, married and has two children who are 5 and 7 years old. For the last 10 years, he has earned a living by providing computer maintenance services. His business has grown because he provides excellent service. He hopes to continue expanding his small company, and is applying for a loan for 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a computer.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Eddy Pantaleon

texts.es: Eddy tiene 45 años, su actividad es la venta y destace de cerdo, el ya ha tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000 y demostrado ser una persona responsable y con un record crediticio muy bueno, el con el crédito anterior se abasteció de cerdos y nos explica que con el apoyo que le han brindado ha permitido tener más cerdos y más clientes. Actualmente esta solicitando crédito para comprar cerdos y poder brindarle a su clientes.
texts.en: Eddy, 45, works butchering pigs and selling pork.  He has had previous credit with Fundación León 2000 and has shown himself to be a responsible person with a very good credit history.  He used his previous loan to stock up on pigs and he explains to us that with the support he’s gotten he’s been able to get more pigs and more customers.  He is currently asking for a loan to buy pigs to have available for his customers.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Alegres es el grupo formado por 17 mujeres de Ciudad del Este, ellas son mujeres muy luchadoras, jefas de familias, que se unieron al programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya con el objetivo de tener mejores oportunidades para poder salir adelante, y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus hijos y familiares. El grupo se encuentra en el primer ciclo, y su meta es poder llegar al máximo nivel.
Nancy es una mujer muy innovadora y trabajadora, dice que tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de celulares y accesorios para estos, el cual empezó muy modestamente, pero que gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo ha podido ir creciendo de a poco, y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus familiares. Su propósito es poder seguir creciendo para poder continuar ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de teléfonos y también para la compra de accesorios, con lo cual tendrá nuevos productos que mostrar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mujeres Alegres (Happy Women) is a group formed by 17 women from the city of Este. They are hard fighting women, heads of family, who joined the program for women entrepreneurs of the Fundación Paraguaya with the objective of having better opportunities of getting ahead, and in this way be able to help their children and relatives. This group is in its first cycle and its goal is to be able to reach the highest level.

Nancy is an innovative and hardworking woman. She says that she has a little business selling cell phones and accessories for them. She began very modestly, but thanks to her effort and work she has been able to grow slowly, and in this way help her relatives. Her aspiration is to be able to continue growing in order to continue helping her family.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy phones and also to buy accessories with which she will have new products that she can show her customers.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and accessories for them

loans.name: Las Rosas De Xequemeya Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria Bernardina es soltera, tiene 18 años de edad, cursó los 5 años de educación primaria, se dedica a la venta de tacos, lo cual lleva 10 años de experiencia con el negocio.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un crédito que lo utilizará para la compra de carne, tomate, cebolla, gas propano, etc. espera en el futuro tener 5 carreta de venta y mejorar sus ganancias. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de animales y otros al comercio.
texts.en:
Maria Bernardina is single and 18 years old. She studied through the fifth year of primary education and works selling tacos. She has 10 years of experience in the busines. 

She organizes a group to be able to request a loan that she will use to buy beef, tomatoes, onions, propane gas, etc. She hopes in the future to have 5 sales carts and increase her earnings. 

The other group members work in raising livestock and in sales.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for selling tacos.

loans.name: Friontina Sonia

texts.es:
Friontina es una mujer de 40naños, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con  su pequeño hijo de 6 años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño ya que ella es madre y padre para él; lamentablemente Friontina no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Gastronomía, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ají de Gallina para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Friontina trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de calzado, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, todas los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien, ya que gracias al buen trato que brinda a sus clientes, cuenta con  clientes seguros.
Friontina se siente muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, tales como cemento, arena, fierros, tubos, etc.; de esta manera Friontina espera poder construir el segundo piso de su vivienda, el cual sea seguro, adecuado y brinde mayor bienestar para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Friontina is a 40-year-old woman who lives in the city of Pisco together with her 6-year-old son who she loves and who is her main focus in life.  She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who puts all her efforts into providing for her little one as she is both mother and father to him.  Unfortunately, Friontina was unable to study for a professional cookery qualification but she would have very much liked to have done so.  In her free time she likes taking part in sports and she sometimes cooks a delicious 'ají de gallina' to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with a lot of determination and dedication, Friontina works every day in her small shoe sales business.  She sells ladies', men's and children's footwear.  She starts work very early every day and is able to work approximately 12 hours a day.  She believes that her business is doing well because she treats her customers well and she has a steady customer base.

Friontina is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, she will be able to buy building supplies such as cement, sand, iron, pipes, etc. in order to build a second floor on her home.  It will be safe, suitable and will improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Luz Elida

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer pujante, servicial y trabajadora, a sus 46 años de edad, es viuda y madre de 1 hijo al que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.

Desde hace 1 año se desempeña en el campo de la confección, prestando el servicio de confección a terceros y a clientes directos, el oficio lo aprendió a través de un amigo, así genera los recursos suficientes para su hogar.

Actualmente se motiva a solicitar el crédito para comprar una maquina fileteadora e insumos al por mayor como telas, hilos, resorte, entre otros, esto le permitirá tener material disponible para cumplir con la entrega oportuna de los pedidos que tiene pendientes, logrando fidelizar a sus clientes actuales.

Luz manifiesta que desea continuar realizando su labor con mucho empeño, pues quiere ampliar su negocio y poder generar oportunidades de empleo, además de garantizar una estabilidad económica para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: comprar una maquina fileteadora e insumos al por mayor como telas, hilos, resorte, entre otros

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
This is a group loan request submitted by the women’s tontine Tessito, represented by Elisabeth S..  Hailing from the village of Oussouye on the banks of the Casamance River in the south of Senegal, the Tessito group’s principal business activity is the cultivation of garden produce for the local market.  They would like to use their loan to expand their gardening activities by purchasing seeds, fertilizer, and basic equipment such as watering cans, rakes, and hoes.  

 

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group.  Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines.  Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities.  Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members.  However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income.  This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities.  Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and gardening equipment

loans.name: Famila

texts.en:
Famila was born in 1945 in Khaladj village, Salyan region, Azebaijan .She is married has 4 children. She is a role model to many young women. 
When she was young she liked to look after cattle with her parents. 
She applies for a loan of $1000 to buy 4 pedigree cows.

loans.use: To buy 4 pedigree cows

loans.name: Faagata

texts.en: Faagata has an exceptional talent for sewing. This talent is in high demand these days in Samoa. Because of the high cost of living, not everybody can afford  to buy dresses or clothes from shops.  Faagata specializes in T-shirts, uniforms, and traditional two-piece outfits (puletasis and muumuus). The 59-year-old caters mostly  to people in her village and works six days a week. Faagata has been sewing for the past 25-30 years.

loans.use: Purchase of materials such as thread, oil for sewing machine, fabric, and paint

loans.name: Taime

texts.en: Taime M. owns a small kiosk in her house in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.  A thirty-one year-old mother of four children, she sells general food items.  Her husband is employed but his income cannot provide for all the family's basic needs.  Taime therefore also supports the family economically from her small business.  With her small business income, she is able to provide her children with school lunches and has repaired the roof of the family home.  She needs the new loan to expand her inventory for better profit.

loans.use: Increase food items inventory for her small kiosk

loans.name: César

texts.en:
Cesar M. Gimenez, 30, is the father of two children. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. He started his business fixing and changing bus tires five years ago. He changes about 15 tires a day and charges US$3 per tire. He buys his tires from a factory closeby and has one other person helping him with his business.

Before Cesar began his business, he used to work for another auto shop. However, he is very happy that he decided to begin his own business. He has been able to increase his income. He is seeking a loan to purchase more tires to keep his business running.

loans.use: Purchase tires.

loans.name: Luzmila Katerine

texts.es:
Luzmila is an enthusiastic and hard-working young woman who for more than 10 years has been selling articles of clothing that she brings from the city of Lima. She sells them in the markets of the little towns bordering the city where she lives, Juliaca. She lives in a rented room that she shares with her beloved mother Rosa and her younger brother. Luzmila wants to grow her business until it is an excellent distributor for articles of clothing. In this way she will generate a bigger income to help her mother with the expenses generated by the construction of the house she wishes for. To make these dreams reality, this beautiful young woman appeals for your unselfish help and asks for a loan of $350 which will allow her to grow her business and make her dreams of having her own house reality. Let’s help her achieve her dream soon.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Luzmila es una joven entusiasta y trabajadora, que desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir que trae de la ciudad de Lima para ofrecerlos en las ferias de los diferentes pueblitos aledaños a la ciudad en la que radica, Juliaca, en un cuarto alquilado que lo comparte junto a su querida madre Rosa y su hermano menor. El deseo que tiene es acrecentar su negocio hasta llegar a convertirse en una excelente distribuidora de prendas de vestir, generando así un mayor ingreso económico para ayudar a su madre en los gastos que genera la construcción de su anhelada vivienda.Para hacer realidad sus deseos esta bella joven recurre a tu ayuda desinteresada y solicita un préstamo de 350 dólares que le permitirá crecer con su negocio y hacer realidad sus sueños de tener su propia casita. Ayudémosla a cumplir su sueño en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Buy more articles in order to consolidate her small store space.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis Gomez is a mechanic in Aregua, Paraguay. He has his own shop where he specializes in automotive electrical problems and also sells and installs car stereo equipment. He is married with a daughter of seven, who attends the local primary school. He and his wife, Maria Amelia, have been married for twelve years. Maria Amelia also works as a notary in the capital city, Asuncion.

Luis has worked in this field for more than 15 years. In 1993 he was forced to go to Argentina for work. It is there that he studied and gained experience working as an automotive electrician. He lived in Argentina for two years and then returned to his native Paraguay. Upon return he opened his store and has been working solo for the past thirteen years. Despite so many years of experience Luis is continuing to better his automotive skills. Today he is taking specific classes on fuel injection in hopes to better his knowledge and expand his shop.

He has asked for a loan to buy a car which he plans to renovate and sell as wel as some parts to complete this work. Luis is good humored and hard working. He is eager to undertake this new project and thankful for the financing opportunity provided by the Fundacion and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a car and parts

loans.name: Getu's Group

texts.en:
Getu L. is a 45 year old married mother of 9 children (ages 29, 28, 25, 24, 18, 16, 15, 13, 10) who trades in cereal grains and pigs. She wants the loan to expand her piggery business and pay school fees for her children.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To expand her piggery business

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Mr. Emilio T. is 54 years old and has a business in the center of the city of Asunción. For more than 25 years he has owned an optician’s shop, where he sells a variety of frames for reading glasses and sunglasses for men, women, and children.

Emilio is a past customer of Fundación Paraguaya, and has for several years now worked with loans provided through the foundation. He is an excellent client and very responsible about his loan payments, all of which he has used to invest in additional merchandise for his business.

Despite the fact that he faces a great deal of competition, Emilio has a well-established customer base and he also works at building new clientele. Today, he is seeking credit to buy additional merchandise because new styles are always being introduced and he wants to always have a well-stocked inventory to meet customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Emilio T., es un hombre de 54 años de edad que tiene un negocio en el centro de la ciudad de Asunción. Emilio posee una óptica hace mas de 25 años, en donde comercializa todo tipo de armazones para anteojos de vista y de sol, para damas, caballeros y niños.

Emilio es un antiguo cliente de la Fundación Paraguaya, lleva ya varios años trabajando con créditos obtenidos de la Fundación, siendo un cliente excelente y responsable en sus pagos, y que los ha invertido siempre en la compra de mercaderías para su negocio.

A pesar de que en la zona existe mucha competencia, Don Emilio, posee su clientela ya formada y periódicamente recibe nuevos clientes. El solicita hoy el crédito para comprar nuevos armazones, pues cada mes salen nuevos modelos y el desea estar siempre al tanto con los diseños novedosos pues sus clientes lo solicitan.

loans.use: Purchase frames for reading glasses and sunglasses.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Mrs. Lim U. , 55, and her husband, Tep Heang, have been married since 1979. They have seven children; six sons and one daughter. Four of their children are employed full time and the others are studying at the local school. The family lives approximately thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. U. has been selling Cambodian cookies and vegetables for four years. She purchases the food products in her village and resells them at the Ta Kmao market in the city. Her husband has been a construction worker for over ten years.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $1000. She will use this money to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for transportation

loans.name: Leonor Isabel

texts.es:
Señora Leonor Isabel Rodríguez D. A. is 49 years old. She finished fifth graD.. She only has one son who still depends on her financially. She lives in the district of Florencia D. Mora, in La Libertad, Peru.

Señora Leonor has a small restaurant which she runs out of her home. She serves lunch and dinner every day. She started by selling home-cooked meals from door to door. Then, she got a little place outsiD. her sister-in-law's house selling home-cooked meals in the evenings, and in the mornings she would dedicate her time washing clothes from her neighbors. Little by little she became known throughout the community, and most of her clients would tell her to open her own business from home, and so she did.

She belongs to the communal bank called 'God Guides Our Steps' where she obtained her first loan. With this money she was able to purchase all sorts of ingredients/supplies to cook.

With this loan, which she will repay within 4 months, she will purchase a bucket of cooking oil, a sack of sugar and rice, and refreshments.

Her biggest dream is to expand her business by buying more tables and chairs.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Leonor Isabel Rodríguez D. A. tiene 49 años D. edad, estudio hasta el quinto grado D. primaria. Tiene un solo hijo que aun depenD. D. ella. Vive en el distrito D. Florencia D. Mora en la provincia D. Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. La señora Leonor tiene un pequeño restaurante en su casa en el que ofrece almuerzos y cena todos los días. Su negocio se inició como ambulante, vendía en un pequeño sitio afuera D. la casa D. su cuñada, vendía por las tardes cachangas, picarones y papa rellena y por las mañanas se dedicaba a lavar ropa D. algunos vecinos que le solicitaban. Poco a poco se fue haciendo conocida y varios clientes le sugerían que abra un local, pues así lo hizo y desD. entonces tiene mayor acogida. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos” lugar donD. obtuvo su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 Con este dinero compró todos los ingredientes necesarios para cocinar. Con el préstamo D. S/. 600.00 el cual lo pagara en cuatro meses comprará un balD. D. aceite, una bolsa D. azúcar, un saco D. arroz y gaseosas D. todo tipo. Su mayor sueño es ampliar su negocio, implementar con mas mesas y sillas.

loans.use: To purchase basic food ingredients

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia has a small stand where she sells wool coats and jackets, working with her husband who makes them in his workshop working with one helper. With this activity, she is able to maintain her two daughters who are in college and in school. Her house is located in the Alto Tejar zone in the city of La Paz.

She seeks credit for working capital (to purchase raw materials and merchandise), to help increase the family’s income.

It is the fourth loan with IMPRO and the second through Kiva. The analysis conducted indicates she qualifies for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Alicia tiene su pequeño puesto de venta donde comercializa abrigos de paño y chamarras, trabaja con su esposo el cual confecciona los abrigos de paño en su taller, emplea a una persona como ayudante. Con esta actividad cubre la manutención de sus dos hijas que están estudiando en la universidad y en el colegio; su vivienda esta ubicado en la Zona Alto Tejar de la Ciudad de La Paz. La beneficiaria solicita crédito para capital de trabajo (compra de materia prima y mercadería), mismo que le servirá para aumentar sus ingresos familiares. Es el cuarto crédito con IMPRO y el segundo vía Kiva, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado por esta clienta.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria Guadalupe B. has been a client of Fundación Leon for six years, during which time she has been the recipient of 17 loans. She is married with five grown children who are themselves married, and she has one child still living with her. Her husband helps her to oversee her business. She relies on two local service taxis as well as a grocery store set up in her home. The loan proceeds have been directed toward both of the businesses. In fact, one of the taxis was financed by the Fundación Leon institution. The current loan is to be used to repair one of the taxis that was in an accident.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Guadalupe B. es cliente de nuetra institución desde hace unos seis años donde ha manejado diesisiete prestamos, Casada con cinco hijos todos casados solamente uno vive con ella, su esposo le ayuda a ver el negocio, Ella cuenta con dos taxis locales ademas de una pulperia en su casa nuestros creditos han sido destinados a los dos negocios, cabe destacar que uno de los taxis fue financiado por nuestra institución, sus condiciones de vida han mejorado asi como sus negocios, este financiamiento lo utiliza para reparar una de las unidades de taxi que le chocaron.

loans.use: Repair of a taxi.

loans.name: Deyli Levinea

texts.es:
Deyli is married to Mr. Ever Javier C. Martinez, who works as a taxi driver. They have 1 daughter, Elisa Yisel, who is one and a half years old.

Deyli began her business because she was moved by a desire to progress economically and give her daughter a good education and a better quality of life. She wanted to earn extra income to help her husband with the costs of the home and between the two of them, to be able to help their daughter and have the possibility of paying for her college education when she is grown.

She began in August of 2006 when her mother-in-law encouraged her to sell cosmetics and women's handbags. First she began to sell them among her friends and neighbors and little by little her clients increased. She has done very well due to this and is thinking of establishing a business in the future.

She needs a loan of US$300 that she will pay in 3 months to acquire a larger selection of beauty products and handbags that are in style to O. better attention to her clients. With your help, Deyli will reach her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. Deyli está casada con el Sr. Ever Javier C. Martínez, quein trabaja como taxista. Tienen 1 hija Elisa Yisel de 1 año y medio. Inició el negocio movida por el deseo de progresar económicamente y darle a su hija una buena educación y un mejor nivel de vida. Ella deseaba obtener un ingreso extra al de su esposo para ayudarlo con los gastos de la casa y entre los dos poder sacar adelante a su hija y tener la posibilidad de que cuando crezca costearle una carrera universitaria. Comenzó en Agosto de 2006 cuando su suegra la animó a vender cosméticos y bolsas de mano para dama, empezo primero vendiendo entre sus amigas y vecinas y poco a poco fueron aumentando sus clientes, por lo cual le ha ido muy bien y esta pensando en un futuro establer el negocio.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para adquirir un mejor surtido de productos de belleza y bolsas de mano de temporada para brindarle una mejor atención a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Deyli lograra su meta

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Nulu Katende's Group

texts.en:
Nulu K., the leader of a group of four women, is 45 years old and married with ten children, all of whom have graduated from school. Nulu lives in a semi-urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season. She sells water and charcoal to her customers, and the biggest difficulty she faces in running her business is the heavy flooding during the rainy season.

Nulu plans on using this loan to boost her business so that she can continue to improve her standard of living. Since she began working with MCDT, she has repaid several loans. These loans have enabled Nulu’s business to prosper, and the resulting profits have allowed her to educate her children. Nulu hopes to be able to continue running her business in order to accumulate additional profits.

loans.use: To increase her stock and boost her business.

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es:
Yeny is 30 years old, married, has two children, a boy and a girl, and stayed in education until the fifth year of secondary school. She lives in Jr. Jose Galvez No. 309 in Llave. She is a member of the Banco Comunal Gregoria A. in Pusuyo, Llave, Collao and two years ago she secured her first loan of S /. 300.00 Nuevos soles, which she used to buy 4 pigs (S /. 35.00 Nuevos Soles each), 4 small sheep (S /. 30.00 Nuevos Soles each) to raise which, when they grew up she sold for a higher price. She currently makes braid beads ('mostasillas'), which she sells wholesale weekly in La Paz Bolivia. With this loan of S /. 1000.00 Nuevos Soles, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy more material to make braid beads and a percentage will be used to buy parquet and ten blocks of tar costing S /. 42.00 Nuevos Soles each. Her vision is to buy a house in Llave and open a restaurant on the first floor and an Internet cafe on the second floor. She has always liked to cook.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Yeny tiene 30 años, casada, tiene dos hijos, un varón y una mujer, estudió quinto de secundaria, vive en el Jr. José Gálvez Nº 309 en el Distrito de Ilave. Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal Gregoria A. de la comunidad de Pusuyo, Distrito de Ilave , Provincia del Collao, hace dos años obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual invirtió comprando 04 chanchos a S/. 35.00 Nuevos Soles cada uno, 04 ovejas pequeñas a S/. 30.00 Nuevos Soles cada uno para engorde, cuando crecieron vendió a más precio, poco a poco fue incrementando sus ganancias, en la actualidad se dedica hacer trencillas de mostasillas, el cual vende por mayor semanalmente en la Paz Bolivia. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles el cual pagará en cuatro cuotas, comprará más material para trabajar con trencillas de mostasillas y un porcentaje comprará parkets, diez bloques de brea a S/. 42.00 Nuevos Soles cada bloque. Su visión es comprar su casa en la Ciudad de Ilave y poner un restaurante en el primer piso y un Internet en el segundo piso, además siempre le gustó cocinar.

loans.use: To buy material to make braid beads (mostasillas). To buy material for flooring.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: La profesora Martha Lorena de 33 años de edad, soltera, sin compromiso, está solicitando su crédito, el que utilizará para la construcción de un cuarto en su vivienda donde levantará solamente 2 paredes, su hermana desde hace 2 años está en Costa Rica con todo su familia y ella habitará sola la casa. De los 7 créditos que ha solicitado uno lo utilizó para comprar un solar, cinco para construcción de su vivienda y uno para los trámites de su título universitario, trabaja con AFODENIC desde el año 2001, se siente bien atendida y los créditos le han servido de mucho pues con su salario de maestra nunca había logrado coronar sus esperanzas de tener una vivienda digna, trabaja como docente en el Instituto San Sebastian con un horario de 1:00p.m a 6:00pm de lunes a viernes desde hace 8 años, plantea que siempre que haya trabajo seguirá invirtiendo en las mejoras de su vivienda para que cuando logre formar una familia ya tenga una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Professor Martha Lorena is 33 years old, single, and is requesting a loan which she will use for the construction of a room in her home where she only needs to put up two walls. Her sister has been in Costa Rica for two yeas with her entire family, so she will live alone in the house. Of the seven loans she has requested, she used one to buy a plot of land, five for the construction of her house, and one for the processing fees for her university degree. She has worked with AFODENIC since 2001 and feels well taken care of. The loans have helped her a lot because her teacher’s salary has never allowed her to achieve her hopes of having a dignified home. She has worked as a teacher at the San Sebastian Institute from 1:00pm until 6:00pm Monday through Friday for the past 8 years. She suggests that as long as there is work, she will keep investing in improvements to her home so when she succeeds in forming a family, she will already have a dignified home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction of a room in her home

loans.name: Alyeris Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Alyeris habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Hialeah III etapa, tiene 24 años de edad, soltera, actualmente estudiante de la universidad, la carrera de Administración de Empresa, lo cual son muchos gastos, pues sus padres le ayudaron para que tuviera un negocio propio donde pudiera ayudarse con sus gastos, pues comenzó vendiendo cosméticos   a sus compañeras de colegio y ha logrado tener muchos clientes, ahora también vende prendas de oro, zapatos, al contado y al crédito, pues ya tiene siete años en las ventas. Con el crédito que esta solicitando es para infraestructura en la compra de materiales de construcción para realizar divisiones de cuarto y sala para tener más privacidad con su familia. A largo plazo es poder tener una tienda con productos variados y terminar su carrera universitaria para lograr un trabajo y tener un buen ingreso.
texts.en:
Alyeris lives in the Hialeah III neighborhood of Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. She is a single 24 year old student, studying business administration at the university. Her schooling is expensive so her parents helped her start her own business to help with the costs. She began by selling cosmetics to other students at the university and she now has lots of customers. She also sells gold jewelry and shoes, partly for cash and partly on credit, and now has seven years in sales. The loan that she's applying for will be used to buy construction materials for subdividing rooms in her house so that she can gain more privacy from her family. In the long term, she wants to have a shop with various products and to finish her university studies so that she can find work and have a good income.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Subdivide rooms.

loans.name: Chan Tha's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan Tha S. is a group leader of four who are all living in Chres Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Sao Pharin, is a blacksmith who can make only a small income to support his family. Mrs. Chan Tha S. is 24 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study because that child is five months old.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans where they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Mavzunahon

texts.en:
Mavzunahon A. lives in Khujand. She is a loving mother of 3 pretty children. Despite the fact that she raises her children alone, she is full of enthusiasm and readiness to work hard to ensure a good future for her children. Mavzunahon is engaged in commercial service and trade. She trades an assortment of children's wear in the local bazaar. For example, she trades the seasonal wear for teenagers (jackets, sports wear and warm socks).

She is an active client of MicroInvest, and she has worked closely with the program since 2005. She is a reliable client who trusts the MicroInvest's loan procedure. Mrs. Mavzunahon A. is applying to KIVA for a loan to import seasonal wear and increase her business turnover. She thanks KIVA for its support and wishes all the best.

loans.use: To import seasonal children's wear and increase business turnover

loans.name: Aneriueta

texts.en: Aneriueta T., 35, is married with 6 children.  She has many years of experience in the Elei (traditional cloth printing) business. She sells to the villagers and general public 6 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Aneriueta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase materials, fabric paints, designs

loans.name: Penh

texts.en:
Mrs. Penh T., 49, and her husband, Mr. Lim Lao, 37, married in 1990 and have four children: one son and three daughters. Two of their children are garment factory workers and the other two children attend school. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Penh has been growing rice since she was married; besides farming she also sells lotus. She buys them from the villagers in her village for re-sale at the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a fisherman and does farming. Penh is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to build a staircase in her house.

loans.use: To build a staircase in her house

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Mrs. Pha C. is a villager in Serei Douch village in Takeo province. She is a firewood seller. Aside from this business, she is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces a problem because she usually pays a lot of money to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy an ox to add to her old one for plowing the field and to reduce her expense.

Mrs. Pha C. is a 45-year-old widow with five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: to buy an ox  for plowing the field

loans.name: Facunda

texts.es:
La señora Facunda A. P. es socia del Banco Comunal “El Comercio”, en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 36 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene a su cuidado 04 hijos, ella acabo sus estudios de primaria completa. 
Ella Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 10 años, su negocio es el engorde de ganado menor y mayor y la comercialización de frutas según la temporada; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con lo que pudo adquirir ganado menor para engorde y su venta en las ferias de Zepita.  
Actualmente ella quiere seguir trabajando con su banquito comunal, ya que le va bien en su negocio. Por ello requiere un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 03 cuotas, el préstamo le será útil para adquirir ganado menor (ovinos y porcinos) para seguir con su negocio de engorde de ganado y su venta en las ferias ganaderas de Zepita; asimismo también quiere invertir en su negocio de frutas según la temporada; su anhelo es comprarse su casa propia en Desaguadero y apoyar en los estudios de sus hijos en el colegio, hasta que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Facunda A. P. is a member of the "El Comercio" Community Bank in the district or Desaguadero, Chucuito Province, in the zone of Puno. She is 36 years of age, married, and has four children under her care. She has finished her primary school studies. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 10 years. She works buying animals to fatten and to sell later and also sells fruit according to what is in season. Her first loan was for 500.00 nuevos soles, which allowed her to purchase more animals to resell in the fairs of Zepita. She currently wants to keep working with her little community bank, since it is going well for her business. She needs a new loan of 3,000.00 nuevos soles, which she will repay in 3 installments. The loan will be used to buy sheep and pigs to continue in her business of fattening livestock and selling them in the livestock fairs in Zepita. She will also continue to invest in her fruit business according to the season. Her desire is to buy herself her own home in Desaguadero and to support the education of her children until they are professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock (sheep and pigs) and invest in her fruit business.

loans.name: Paz Y Amor Group 6

texts.en:
Paul G. is the leader of the group called Paz y Amor, or in English, “Peace and Love.” Paul is the owner of a used clothing business that he operates in his community. He and his wife of six years, Girena, have three children, ages 4, 3, and 16 months.

Paul’s dream for his business is to keep growing and have a larger capacity to sell clothing. Eventually he would like to buy a storefront for his business. He would like to be able to own his own house and be able to provide a good life for his children. In his free time, Paul enjoys attending his church with his family. This is his second loan and because of his faithfulness in repaying his last one, it is for a larger amount of money.

On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for your interest in these entrepreneurs and effort to fight the global issue of poverty!

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Kaimer

texts.es: Kaimer tiene  35 años, su vitalidad le ayuda a trabajar y proteger a su familia cada día, conformada por su esposa y sus dos hijas, su familia vive toda junta en una pequeña casa. La experiencia que obtuvo desde joven lo llevó a dedicarse plenamente al transporte de pasajeros, actividad que realiza todas los días a partir de las 4 de la tarde hasta altas horas de la madrugada, pues tiene que cumplir el horario de trabajo de la empresa transportes donde labora por más de 10 años. Dicha labor está ocasionándole algunas molestias físicas, pues sus horas de descanso son muy pocas, siendo éste el lado desagradable de su ocupación como chofer, pero tiene la necesidad trabajar por el bienestar de su familia. Es así que tiene pensado  iniciar un trabajo adicional con su esposa, pues ella tiene mucha habilidad para las ventas, habilidad que desean explotar al máximo instalando una tienda en su casa, aprovechando la escasez de este tipo de negocio por su localidad, y la gran demanda por parte de sus vecinos y amigos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y está seguro que esta oportunidad le ayudará a seguir creciendo, además se considera una persona muy responsable, dando fe de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos para su auto y algunos productos para empezar a reunir la mercadería para su futura tienda.
texts.en:
Kaimer is 35 years old. His vitality helps him every day to work and protect his family, which is comprised of his wife and their two daughters. His family lives together in a small house. The experience he had when he was younger caused him to work solely in public transportation. He works from 4:00 pm until the early hours of the morning, according to his work schedule from the transportation company for whom he was worked for more than 10 years. The disagreeable aspects of his job as a driver are that it causes him some physical discomfort and he does not have much time to rest. However he has to work for the well being of his family. He has thought of starting an extra business with his wife since she has a lot of skill in sales. They want to take full advantage of that skill by putting a store in their home, as there is a scarcity of that type of business in their neighborhood and a lot of demand from their neighbors and friends. This is his first loan with MFP, and he is certain this opportunity will help him keep growing. Furthermore, he is considered to be a very responsible person who will make the loan payments on time. He will use the requested money to buy parts for his car and some products to begin to gather the merchandise for their future store.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy parts for his car

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma S. is 53 years old, married and has four children. Her youngest is in high school; the others have all graduated and are now independent. Emma lives with her husband and youngest child in Abeka, a suburb of Accra. She is a very resourceful woman whose hard work has helped her husband give their children a good education. 

Emma makes a living baking bread and selling provisions. She buys her raw materials – flour, margarine, sugar, etc -- from the big markets in Accra where they are readily available. She bakes and distributes her bread to beverage sellers and other bread merchants in her community at wholesale prices. She has been in business for 27 years. Emma has applied for a loan to expand her business by buying materials in bulk so that she can distribute to a larger number of customers. Emma is a member of a trust group called “Mawulawe,” which means that things are in God's hands. The group members guarantee each other's loans, and provide assistance in making timely repayments.

loans.use: To purchase baking ingredients -- such as flour, margarine, sugar, etc -- in bulk.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru:
Ахмедова Гульбахор- женщина 56-ти лет, замужем, имеет 4-х детей.Чтобы прокормить свою семью она вместе со своим мужем  занимается откормом и купля-продажей скота.Живет она в селе где нет работы. Основной источник дохода это выращивание сельской хозяйственной  культуры и  Переводы с России. Ее старший сын присылает ей немного денег, но теперь из-за кризиса он последние 2 месяца не присылал денег.  
Она продала быка и  планировала купить дойную корову. Но корова стоит дороже и для этого она обратилась за кредитом в Микроинвест. Узнала об условиях кредита. После получения кредита купила корову. Теперь у нее есть несколько дойных коров.  Она благодарна КИВА за поддержку.
texts.en:
Gulbahor A. is 56 years old, married and has 4 children. Together with her husband, she is involved in livestock feeding and sales in order to support their family. She lives in a village where there is no work. The main source of income is agriculture and money transfers from Russia. Her oldest son sends some money home, but because of the economic crisis, he has not sent any money last two months. Gulbahor sold a bull and planned to buy a dairy cow. However, because the cow costs more than she expected, Gulbahor requested a loan from MicroInvest. She learned about the lending terms and purchased a cow after receiving her loan. Now she owns several dairy cows. Gulbahor is grateful to Kiva for the support.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchase of cattle

loans.name: Doem

texts.en: The person who wears the red-shirt in the photo is L., age 40. She lives in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She has built a small salon shop in front of her house where she sells a few ladies’ beauty salon products to neighbors in the village. She generates an average of $4 profit a day to feed her family. She has three children who are of school age. The other income for the family comes from her husband’s work, driving a truck for a small firm. L. runs her business very well and she hopes to better meet her customer's requirements by using a loan from Kiva to expand the selection of beauty salon items to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of beauty salon products to sell.

loans.name: Karema

texts.en: Karema is the daughter of S. K.. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan, and she has a beauty salon. She wants to take a loan of 42,000 AFN to expand her business. So she is very happy to have the opportunity for a loan in Afghanistan.

loans.use: Expand her beauty salon

loans.name: Seth

texts.en:
Seth Y. is 28 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. She is married and blessed with two school-aged children. She is currently on the cleaning staff of a private English school. Her husband works driving a taxi as well as in construction for income. 

Seth Y. will be use the loan money to decorate her house to build a small store, where she will begin selling a few groceries to neighbors. This will provide her with additional profit through selling grocery items.

loans.use: To decorate her house and build a small store to begin selling a few groceries

loans.name: Atoo

texts.en:
Atoo F. is currently in the business of selling bread and charcoal and is requesting a loan to open up a shop.  Atoo is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a cattle keeper. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a shop

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en: Mariama is forty years old. She is a wife and mother of five children who are currently in school. She is a retailer of charcoal at her local community. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all the traditional Ghanaian homes. Mariama obtains her supply of charcoal from the villages and retail them to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more supply of charcoal to increase her stock and believes she would be able to make better income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy more supply of charcoal

loans.name: Juana Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Juana Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, del  distrito de J., provincia de Chucuito,  departamento de Puno, ella tiene 43 años de edad,  es casada y vive actualmente  con su esposo, esta al cuidado de sus tiene 3 hijos, ella tiene estudios de primaria incompleta (4to de primaria)

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace más de un año, su primer préstamo fue de S/300.00 nuevos soles monto que le sirvió para adquirir mercadería para su negocio de venta de golosinas, galletas y gaseosas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles con el préstamo ella podrá adquirir mas mercadería en golosinas, galletas, gaseosas y también en material para elaborar productos de bordados en bayeta lo cual los  venderá en diferentes ferias de la región con mas frecuencia en la Isla de los Uros.

Su mayor deseo es comprarse un carro para facilitar  el traslado de su mercadería, y que su casa este totalmente concluida como ella quiere, que sus hijos sean buenos  profesionales para que no tengan problemas económicos en el futuro.

A ella le gusta las reuniones, la puntualidad, los ahorros y sus ganancias.

loans.use: Para la compra de golosinas, galletas, gaseosas y produtos para bordados.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es: Ernesto R. A. reside en el municipio de Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador. Ernesto tiene 53 años de edad, es un hombre casado y padre de su único hijo Mauricio de 21 años de edad. La familia A. es muy unida posee un negocio que da servicios de moler, en el negocio es atendido por Ernesto con el apoyo de su hijo, el crédito que solicita Ernesto es para comprar un nuevo motor para su molino, porque el que tiene en este momento falla con frecuencia , quedando mal con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ernesto R. A. resides in the municipality of Apopa in the San Salvador area. Ernesto is 53 years old, married, and the father of a son, Mauricio, who is 21 years old. The A. family is very united. They own a business that provides milling services. This business is run by Ernesto with the support of his son. The loan that Ernesto is requesting will be used to purchase a new motor for the mill, because the one he owns now fails frequently, creating a bad impression with his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a new motor for his mill

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more  foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita G. is from the village of Tagulalo, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 58 years old. Jovita is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Jovita sells flowers in the local community. Jovita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jovita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Jovita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional flowers to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Jovita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional flowers to sell

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nieves tiene 60 años, hace un año quedó viuda, tiene 4 hijos y actualmente solo vive con uno D. ellos.	Edad, estado civil, miembros D. su familia.
Tras la pérdida D. su esposo, pensó que no podría ocuparse sola D. sus cultivos D. hortalizas, pero gracias a Dios aun mantiene la misma vitalidad y energía para continuar trabajando en su campo D. cultivo, menciona. Es así que todos los días, desD. las 10 D. la mañana hasta las 5 D. la tarD. trabaja en sus chacras, pero cuando tiene demasiado trabajo recurre al apoyo D. sus hijos que viven cerca D. ella.  
Ahora Nieves está reestablecida D. una fractura que tuviese hace un tiempo debido a una fuerte caída, y pese a su edad está predispuesta a seguir luchando y progresando con sus cultivos. Ella menciona que el trabajo es lo único que la entretiene D. su soledad y ausencia D. su esposo. Además está muy agradecida con la tierra que posee, ya que toda su vida le ha dado buenas cosechas y en base a ello les dio sustento y educación a sus hijos que ahora viven independientemente. 

Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP y su mayor anhelo es continuar con su labor en el campo. Asimismo, menciona que llegó a tenerle mucho cariño a su banco comunal por ser personas muy solidarias, y confiesa ser la primera en llegar a sus reuniones D. cada mes. Con el dinero que ahora solicita invertirá en la compra D. semillas D. zanahorias y espinacas para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Nieves is 60 years old and became a widow one year ago. She has 4 children and currently lives with one of them.

After her husband passed away, Nieves was worried that she would not be able to maintain her crops on her own. Thanks to God, she has been able to maintain the same level of vitality and energy so that she can continue working in the fields. Nieves works every day on her farm from 10am to 5pm. Whenever there is too much work for her to handle, she has the support of her children who live nearby.

Nieves recently recovered from a fracture she suffered as a result of a heavy fall. Despite her age, she is determined to keep fighting and improving her crops. She mentions that her work is the only thing that keeps her mind off her loneliness and the absence of her husband. Nieves is also grateful for the land she possesses, since it is the means by which she provided sustenance and an education for her children who are now grown.

Nieves is receiving her seventh loan with MFP. Her greatest desire is to continue farming. She says that she has great affection for the members of her Communal Bank, who have been very supportive. She also admits to being the person who always arrives first at their monthly meetings. Nieves will use the money to buy carrot and spinach seeds for the next planting season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds

loans.name: Virina

texts.en:
Virina is a single mother with three sons, all of whom are grown, ages 29, 23, and 19. Virina used to work as a maid in a home, but the pay was not good enough to support her family, so she decided to go into recycling.

Approximately 9 years ago, a kind gentleman gave Virina a stack of cartons which she could recycle immediately. So she started buying a horse and cart and began to go around the city collecting recyclable material. Now Virina has two carriages and horses, one of which is operated by her sons. Virina’s hope is that one day she will be able to buy a truck to move the materials faster and have more business. She will use her loan to invest in her venture.

loans.use: Business investment

loans.name: Anne Mwelu

texts.en:
Anne Mwelu P. owns the Solang Centre on Mwatu Wa Ngoma street in Machakos town. She has been in this business for one year and sells soft drinks, stationery, phones and phone accessories. Her business challenge is strong competition from similar businesses, so she will use the loan of 30,000 KES to buy binding and photocopy machines. In addition to the Solang Centre, Anne also runs a cyber cafe which is another source of income for her.

She is 26 years old and married to a businessman. They have a five-year-old daughter. Anne describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy photocopy and binding machines.

loans.name: Yèrèdèmè Group

texts.fr:
Yèrèdèmè est un regroupement de 4 femmes mariées dans des ménages monogames ayant en moyenne 41 ans, 5 enfants et  habitant dans  le quartier Pelengana Sud de la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers et décida d’intégrer le  programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui elles sont à leur 3ème  prêt solidaire après avoir remboursé les deux précédents, afin de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance . 
Ce troisième prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 2 pièces de 30 mètres de bazin, 10 tenues pantalon chemises, 10 tenues culottes chemises,10 tenues jupe tee shorts,  6 robes, 24 flacons de parfums, une douzaine de crèmes à lèvre, 2 paquets de boucles d’oreille et  2 douzaines de portes monnaies. 
Elles s’approvisionnent en bazin blanc au grand marché pour ensuite les teindre, les habits pour enfants et les portes monnaies sont également achetés au grand marché de Ségou, les parfums, les crèmes à lèvre, les boucles d’oreille sont achetés au  Burkina Faso. 
La vente de leurs marchandises se fait généralement au marché château de Ségou, à domicile et en ambulant  dans le quartier au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femmes. 
Elles  espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 32.750FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement du prêt de Soro Yiriwaso, la contribution dans la prise en charges de certaines dépenses familiales et la participation aux évènements sociaux (mariages, baptêmes, circoncisions et funérailles). 
Leurs ambitions se résument à l’augmentation du montant de leurs prêts avenir.
texts.en:
Yèrèdèmè is made up of four married women who are in monogamous marriages. They average 41 years of age, five children and live in the Pelengana South neighbourhood of the city of Segou (Fourth admnistrative region of Mali).
