The least Foai realizes from her sales is never less than $600ST a week. Foai’s savings passbook shows that she saves more than the usual person in business.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing equipment and tools

loans.name: Korneliya

texts.en: Korneliya R. specializes in gifts, souvenirs, and decorative household items. A true entrepreneur, Korneliya saw an opportunity to develop a business that caters to tourists and visitors to Mukachevo, Ukraine, where she operates her business. Her unique kiosk faces little direct competition and has grown over the six years she has been in business. Korneliya is friendly and lively and has developed an excellent reputation among clients and tourists. She is attentive to the needs of her customers and professional in working with her creditors. Due to previous loans through Nadiya Ukraine, Korneliya has been able to increase her inventory and successfully expand her business. As such, she has helped her husband Ivan to provide a better standard of living for their family of four. Currently, Korneliya is seeking a loan for $1,100. This loan will help her to increase the variety of her inventory. With the additional profits, Korneliya hopes to increase her working capital and purchase a car.

loans.use: Increase variety of inventory

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos is 35 years old. He married Dionisia 2 years ago, though he adds that they have lived together for the past 15 years. His wife is 36 years old. She is a housewife who dedicates herself to raising their three children, ages 13, 6, and 3 years old. Their oldest son is in 8th grade and their second son will soon be in first grade.

Carlos is a mechanic and runs a shop out of his house. He learned the trade at another shop, until he had the opportunity to begin his own business.

He mentions that a year ago, his wife underwent surgery and he had to sell some of his equipment to pay for her medical care. Once the family overcame that situation, he was able to return to his work thanks to much effort and dedication. He dreams of opening a larger shop where he can better attend to his clientele and incorporate the sale of parts for all types of vehicles.

He always uses loans to invest in the purchase of tools. This time, he needs to buy soldering equipment which will cost approximately $300 USD.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos tiene 35 años, está casado con Dionisia hace 2 años pero comenta que conviven juntos desde hace 15 años aproximadamente. Su esposa que ahora tiene 36 años es ama de casa y se dedica al cuidado y la educación de sus 3 hijos de 13, 6 y 3 años respectivamente. El mayor de sus hijos cursa el 8vo. Grado de la secundaria y el segundo ya va al primer grado de la primaria.

Carlos es mecánico de profesión y tiene un taller mecánico que funciona en su casa propia. Comenzó trabajando en un taller ajeno en donde aprendió todo lo que sabe hasta que tuvo la oportunidad de montar el suyo propio.

Comenta que hace un año su esposa tuvo que ser intervenida quirúrgicamente razón por la cual tuvo que vender varias de sus herramientas para costear todos los gastos que demandó dicha intervención. Una vez superada dicha situación logró remontar nuevamente su trabajo, gracias a mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Sueña con levantar alguna vez un tinglado en donde podrá atender mejor a su clientela además de incorporar la venta de repuestos para vehiculos de todo tipo.

Siempre recurre a los préstamos los cuales invierte en la compra de herramientas, en esta oportunidad necesita adquirir una soldadura cuyo costo es de aproximadamente U$S 300.

loans.use: To buy tools.

loans.name: Tulganoi

texts.ru:
Even though Tulganoi is 57 years old, she sells her wares in the local market. It is the main source of income for her family. She has 4 children. Two of her children help Tulganoi with her business. The assortment of the products she sells include all necessary items for a home as well as children’s toys and gift sets. Her oldest son (in the picture above) travels to buy her inventory while Tulganoi and her daughter sell them in the market. A year ago Tulganoi received a loan from MicroInvest. Since then she has been an active client of MicroInvest. She wants a new loan to further expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers

Несмотря на свои 57 лет Тулганой выходит на базар торговать. Торговля составляет основной источник дохода семьи. У нее 4 детей. Двое из них выходят помогать матери. Ассортимент ее товаров включает все необходимое для дома, а также детские игрушки и подарочные наборы. За товаром ездит ее старший сын (на фото), а Тулганой и ее дочь торгуют на рынке. Год назад она получила займ в Микроинвест и с тех пор постоянно сотрудничает. Новый займ пойдет на дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
In the Santa Clara market in the middle of Ayacucho, Perú, Lilia sits on a stool behind a mountain of fresh vegetables and grains. For the past 10 years, Lilia, or “Liliana,” as her friends and neighbors know her, has been selling carrots, celery, tomatoes, onions, broccoli, cauliflower, and just about every other vegetable imaginable to her community in this small Andean city.

Before there were vegetables, there were cereals. These Lilia also sold and continues to sell in the market from her stand. The cereals consist of everything from wheat to barley, and they come from the country just outside the city limits. After several years of selling only cereals, it was clear to Lilia that she was not making enough profit to support a healthy lifestyle. Thus, she decided she needed to increase the variety of products she sold in order to supplement her income. This she did, and it is now to vegetables that she dedicates the majority of her time and energy. She happily reports that her decision was a great success, and she now serves a large number of regular customers counting on her for their daily supply of leafy greens and cereals. It is a very important business concept, explains Lilia. If one does not provide a variety of products, the customers will shop elsewhere.

This motivated 27 year-old has many goals and aspirations for her growing vegetable business. She says she is always looking for ways to improve, and she has her eye set on a permanent stand within the market. Currently, Lilia is an “ambulante,” which means she sells from a mobile stand and spends most of the day walking. A permanent stand would allow her greater consistency and the supply of a much greater quantity of products. This is an especially important time for Lilia to be expanding her business as she is newly pregnant with her first child. Thanks to her village bank, such expansion is a real possibility. For the past 3 years, Lilia has learned how to save her money and she says thanks to her bank, she has increased exponentially the amount of products she is able to move daily. Lilia is requesting a loan of $550. With this money, she will buy larger quantities of cereals and vegetables, especially carrots.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of cereals and vegetables, especially carrots

loans.name: Lach

texts.en: Mr. Lach C., 34, is married with four children and lives with his wife in Bathambong province Cambodia. He works as a motor-taxi driver, making around $3 each day. His wife works selling grocery products in her community, making about $5 per day. One of her children is self employed as a motor-taxi driver and the rest are enrolled in school. Mr. Lach C. hopes to use this loan to purchase a new motorcycle to replace his old one, which frequently needs repairs. He believes the new motor-bike will save him and his family much more money. He will use another part of the loan to purchase more grocery products for his wife to meet her customer demands. ( His wife is pictured with her grocery stand while Mr. Lach C. was on his way to operate his business).

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle to operate a business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is married and her husband works as a driver. They have 5 children who all attend school. The oldest of her daughters, helps her take care of the other children and the business in the afternoons, and attends highschool in the mornings.

Juana has a small dispensary in her house which she opened several years ago. She sells all kinds of every day items such as sugar, flour, noodles, fruits and vegetables, sodas, dairy products, cookies, and various household products. She began with very little capital and now has a larger business which is much better stocked.

The loan she is requesting is to buy more merchandise for her store.

Juana es una mujer casada, su marido es chofer de una línea de transporte, tienen cinco hijos todos aun están en edad escolar, la mayor de sus hijas, la ayuda por las tardes a atender a los niños y el negocio ya que por las mañanas asiste al colegio.

Juana posee una despensa en su casa que lo abrió hace varios años, en el mismo vende todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad, como azúcar harina, fideos, frutas, verduras, gaseosas, productos enlatados, golosinas, galletitas dulces, productos para la casa, entre otras cosas. Ella empezó con un muy pequeño capital y hoy día ya posee un negocio mas grande y surtido.

El crédito que solicita la señora será utilizado para la compra de mercaderías.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MERCHANDISE FOR HER SMALL STORE, SUCH AS FRUITS AND VEGETABLES, DAIRY PRODUCTS, NOODLES, AND VARIOUS HOUSEHOLD ITEMS.  THE SMALL DISPENSARY SHE RUNS FROM HER HOME HELPS SUPPORT HER 5 CHILDREN.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Mrs. Kuthea R. and her husband have been married since 1998. They have two sons; one is studying in primary school and the youngest one stays at home. The family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb.

She and her husband have been in the business of raising pigs and ducks since 2003. They raise almost one hundred pigs on the farm behind their house. Besides the raising of pigs and ducks, they also raise fish.

Mrs. R. is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1200. She will use this money to purchase additional feed and to repair her mother's house.

loans.use: To purchase feed and house repairs

loans.name: Sofia's Group

texts.en:
Sofia, Elvira and Karina have been part of the Legioncito Comunal Bank for 1 year, 4 months and 4 months respectively. They learned to be responsible, punctual and mainly to save.

Sofia is 32 years old with 3 children. Sofia and her husband have a small mechanical heavy machinery shop. In addition, Sofía is planning on starting a new business of selling machinery parts.

Elvira is 19 years old and single. Elvira sells clothes. She brings them from Lima. Additionally Elvira and her sister buy toys wholesale and resale them in street fairs.

Karina is 24 years old and has 1 son. Karina buys chickens from the farms and sells them in the fairs. Karina is working on having her own farm.

Sofía, Elvira and Karina need a loan of 400 suns, 400 suns, 1200 suns respectively, money that will be invested in the purchase of coats, trousers, chickens and school supplies.

The dreams of Sofía, Elvira and Karina are that their children would go to college, to build their own house and to have a farm.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Sofía, Elvira y Karina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Legioncito hace 1 año, 4 meses, 4 meses respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ahorrar, ser responsables y puntuales.

Sofía es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Sofía junto a su esposo tienen un taller mecánico de maquinaria pesada. Además Sofía iniciará un nuevo negocio de venta de repuestos en un local alquilado.

Por otro lado Elvira es soltera y tiene 19 años, Elvira vende ropa, sus productos son traídos de la ciudad de Lima. Además por campaña trae juguetes que vende junto a su hermana en la feria de las Nazarenas.

Mientras que Karina es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, Karina vende pollos para criar, los compra en las granjas y los vende en las ferias. Karina esta implementando su propia granja.

Sofía, Elvira y Karina necesitan préstamos de 400 soles, 400 soles, 1200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de casacas, pantalones, pollos bebes y para los útiles de sus hijos.

Los sueños de Sofía, Elvira y Karina son que sus hijos sean profesionales, construir su casa, tener una tienda propia y una granja.

loans.use: Sofía, Elvira and Karina need a loan of 400 suns, 400 suns, 1200 suns respectively, money that will be invested in the purchase of coats, trousers, chickens and school supplies.

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.es:
Peregrina is a very diligent woman, joyful and friendly, for many years she worked at countless activities in order to generate enough income for her beloved family. Nonetheless none of the jobs earned as much as she would have liked, and so at the invitation of one of her friends she decided to sell beauty products through catalogs. At first this business did not seem very profitable, but as she expanded her market base offering her products in other cities, things began to change. Now Peregrina has made this business her major source of income and that of her family. In this opportunity, seeing the large amount of requests that she obtains from month to month and the supply of cosmetics maintained, she would like to take advantage of this by acquiring the products in order to have them in stock and sell them at convenient prices. Your support will allow Peregrina’s hopes to become a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Peregrina, es una mujer muy diligente, alegre y amigable, durante muchos años se dedicó a innumerables actividades para generar ingresos económicos suficientes para su amada familia, sin embargo ninguna de las labores que desempeñaba cubrían sus expectativas, es así que por invitación de una de sus amigas decidió vender productos de belleza a través de catálogos, en un principio este negocio no parecía ser tan rentable, pero conforme ampliaba su mercado ofreciendo sus productos en otras ciudades las cosas empezaron a cambiar.Actualmente doña Peregrina hizo de este negocio su más importante ingreso económico y la de su familia, en esta oportunidad viendo la gran cantidad de solicitudes que obtiene mes a mes y la oferta que mantienen los productos cosméticos desea aprovechar en adquirirlos para tenerlos en stock y venderlos a precios cómodos.Tu aporte permitirá concretar los deseos de Peregrina.

loans.use: Capital increase to acquire more products

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
Maria Rosario M. D. ValverD.'s main business is an internet and Entel Point (telephone calls). She is a single mother and is in charge of paying for her son's education. For this reason she continues working so that she can help him get ahead. She lives in a house with her parents.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

LA SEÑORA MARIA ROSARIO M. D. VALVERD. TIENE COMO PRINCIPAL ACTIVIDAD SERVICIO D. INTERNET Y PUNTO ENTEL (LLAMADAS TELEFÓNICAS), LA SEÑORA ES MADRE SOLTERA Y TIENE A SU CARGO LA EDUCACION D. SU HIJO POR EL CUAL ELLA SIGUE TRABAJANDO PARA PODERLE SACAR ADELANTE ELLA VIVE EN LA CASA D. SUS PADRES

loans.use: To purchase phone cards

loans.name: Houk

texts.en:
Houk T., 47, is married and lives with her five children in Siem Reap Province, where she works in a grocery store and her husband works in security. Their combined revenue is above $50, but their profits are low and the cost of living is high. They are also supported by one of their children who sells souvenirs by the temple.

Inflation has driven up prices across Cambodia, and even attaining basic necessities such as food and gasoline have become daily struggles for many people. Houk T. has approached CREDIT for a loan of $300 to purchase more groceries for her store. She feels that this sustainable investment will help increase her profits and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase groceries.

loans.name: Kossi Jean

texts.fr:
Mr. Kossi Jean S. was born on August 16, 1972 in the town of Tohoun, located at the center of the prefect (district) of Mono. He is married and the father of four (4) children. In 2003 he opened a store selling basic grocery items in the Agoe neighborhood of Lome. He has five (5) years experience in this business and always responds to the needs of his customers.

To increase his stock and insure that he has adequate supplies, Mr. S. is requesting his first business loan to purchase four (4) cans of oil, six (6) sacks of rice, eight (8) cartons of milk and fifteen (15) cartons of spaghetti.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur S. Kossi Jean est né la 16 août 1972 à Tohoun dans la préfecture de moyen Mono. Il est marié et père de quatre (5) enfants. En 2003, il a ouvert un magasin de vente des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Avec cinq années d’expérience dans ce commerce, il répond toujours aux besoins de ses clients. Pour augmenter son stock et éviter les ruptures de stock, monsieur S. Kossi Jean sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 4 bidons d’huile, 6 sacs de riz, 8 cartons de lait et 15 cartons de spaghetti.

loans.use: Purchase of basic grocery products

loans.name: Ni Ketut Suwardi

texts.id:
Verging on 49 years of age, Ni Ketut Suwardi is keen about developing her livestock business that she began six months ago. With a sufficiently permanent stable and two pigs for breeding, Ni Ketut Suwardi has already gained respectable earnings of Rp.1.000.000 (approx. US$109) in six months. However, Ni Ketut Suwardi has not had an opportunity to develop her business further with these earnings because she has been facing rising prices driven by increased gas prices. As a result, Ni Ketut Suwardi is eager for additional working capital from DINARI Foundation which can help her purchase feed and expand the number of her livestock.

Ni Ketut Suwardi not only works diligently on her business but also daily helps her husband in his work as a farmer. She does all this to sustain the family and finance their three kids. Although Ni Ketut Suwardi and her husband have not studied past elementary school, they yearn for all their children to undergo higher education. Developing this livelihood business, Ni Ketut Suwardi wishes to realize her dream of schooling her children to the highest level.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Aarati, Kiva volunteer.

Memasuki usia ke 49 tahun Ni Ketut Suwardi sangat bersemangat dalam mengembangkan usaha ternak babi yang baru dirintisnya sejak 6 bulan yang lalu. Dengan bermodalkan sebuah kandang yang cukup permanen dan 2 ekor ternak peliharaan, Ni Ketut Suwardi sudah mendapatkan keuntungan yang cukup lumayan yaitu Rp. 1.000.000.- / 6 bulan. Namun, belum sempat Ni Ketut Suwardi dapat mengembangkan usahanya dengan hasil keuntungan yang di peroleh , kini dia telah di hadapkan dengan permasalahan kenaikan harga barang-barang karena pengaruh kenaikan BBM ( Bahan Bakar Minyak ). Oleh karena itu Ni Ketut Suwardi sangat berharap bisa mendapatkan tambahan modal dari Dinari yang akan dipergunakan untuk menambah modal baik dalam pembelian bibit maupun untuk biaya pakannya , sehingga jumlah peliharaanya akan lebih banyak.

Dalam keseharianya Ni Ketut Suwardi sangat tekun dalam usaha maupun membantu pekerjaan suami yang bekerja sebagai seorang petani. Semua itu dia lakukan untuk menyambung hidup dan membiayai ke tiga orang anaknya. Meskipun hanya tamatan Sekolah Dasar, Ni Ketut Suardi dan Suami sangat merindukan semua anaknya bisa mengenyam pendidikan yang lebih tinggi . Dengan mengembangkan usaha ternak ini , besar harapan Ni Ketut Suwardi untuk dapat mewujudkan impiannya menyekolahkan anak bungsunya sampai ketingkat yang lebih tinggi.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia Z. D. C. tiene 52 años y vive en la Avenida Quiñigon  sin número sector Miramar D. distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad  Perú.
Estudió hasta el tercer año de primaria, no siguió estudiando porque sus padres eran personas muy pobres y ella desde muy pequeña tuvo que empezar a ayudarlos a trabajar.
Se casó con el señor Birilo C. con el que tuvo cuatro hijos, pero solo dos dependen de ella económicamente.
Se dedica a la compra venta de animales menores y compra venta de trigo o menestra de la estación, lo que puede venderlo en grano o en harina, manifiesta que vender el trigo en harina cuesta más y su ganancia es mayor. Su negocio lo realiza en su casa.
Recuerda que el primer préstamo que obtuvo de Manuela Ramos fue de 300 soles para ser devueltos en cuatro  meses, compró cuyes y gallinas a muy buen precio y los vendió ganando muy bien.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2000 soles, el cual pagara en 4 cuotas, comprará dos cerdos y dos ovejas.
Julia sueña con conocer el Perú de norte a sur. 
Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Mache.
texts.en:
Julia Zaveleta D. Castilo is 52 years old and lives on Quinigon Avenue in Miramar, a town in the Otuzco province of La Libertad, Peru. Julia is a member of the Communal Bank of Women of Mache and dreams for seeing all of Peru, from north to south. Julia finished 3rd grade and then went to work with her parents. She was unable to continue studying because her parents were very poor. Julia later married Birilo C. and had four children. Two of their children still depend on their parents for support and the other two have moved on. Julia works out of her home as a trader. She specializes in buying and selling agricultural products such as small animals and grain. She sells grain in both seed form and flour form (flour earns better profits). Julia has taken out one loan from Manuela Ramos previously. The first loan was for S/. 300 (apx. $100) and was repaid within four months. Julia used the funds to purchase guinea pigs and chickens at a very low price, which she later resold at a good profit. Julia is now requesting a loan of S/. 2,000 ($675). She will similarly repay this loan in four months and plans to purchase two hogs and two lambs.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hogs and lambs.

loans.name: Sothavy's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan, and there are four group members. Mrs. Sothavy Thom is one member of the group, and she was selected to be the group leader. Sothavy is 24 years old, and she grows vegetables on her farmland (behind her house) and later sells the vegetables at the market. By doing so, she earns approximately US$4 per day. In addition, Sothavy is married to Mr. Mak Orn; they do not have any children. She is seeking a loan in the amount of US$150 to purchase fertilizer to use on her vegetable crops. The other three group members are as follows:

1 Mrs. Sokhem P. grows vegetables to sell, and she also requests a loan in the amount of US$150 to purchase fertilizer for her vegetable crops;

2 Mrs. Chantha T. grows vegetable crops, and she seeks a loan in the amount of US$100 to purchase fertilizer; and

3 Mr. Noeum C. has a rice mill, and he requests a loan in the amount of US$100 to purchase rice to then grind for sale.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to use on her vegetable crops

loans.name: Dzouéra

texts.fr: Née en 1982 à Takoura, Madame A. Dzouéra est mère d’un enfant. Très tôt elle entre en apprentissage pour vite subvenir à ses besoins. Couturière de profession, elle n’a pas suffisamment de moyens pour s’acheter des machines à coudre ce qui fait que sa seule machine ne lui permet pas de satisfaire les commandes de sa clientèle. Elle sollicite un crédit de 50.000 F pour acquérir une nouvelle machine et mieux être à la hauteur de son activité.
texts.en:
Born in 1982 in Takoura, Mrs. Dzouéra A. is the mother of one child. Early on, she learned a job to provide for herself. A trained seamstress, she lacks financial means to buy sewing machines, and her only machine does not enable her to meet customer demand. She's seeking a loan of XOF 50'000 to purchase a new machine and to improve her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa A. M. is 34 years old and is married with four children. Three of her children are in school in Rongo, Kenya.

Teresa has been selling second hand clothing in Rongo since 2006. She is applying for a loan of 10,000 Kenya Schillings in order to purchase more second hand clothes to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase second hand clothes

loans.name: Sa

texts.en: Sa P., 56, is married with 7 children.  She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public 3 days per week. She has had 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 750 Tala (about $312 USD).  SPBD loans are Sa’s only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase Gromoxone, sting, weedkiller chemical, and taro tops for planting

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Mr. Sophoin N., 30, and his wife, Mrs. Sreytouch Phan, 30, who live in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia, have been married for ten years and have three children: two sons and one daughter, all of whom attend school.

Sophoin has been growing vegetables for eight years. He also buys them from the villagers in his village for re-sale at the market in Phnom Penh. His wife has been raising ducks for ten years, a skill she learned by herself. Sophoin and his wife hope to set up their own shop to sell food and rice. Sophoin is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a trailer to carry vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to carry vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nhao

texts.en:
A farmer in Chen village in Takeo Province, Mr. Nhao Y. owns a plot of land upon which he cultivates rice to earn a living. Because his soil is now infertile, he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for the land and fuel to operate his irrigation system. He will use the remainder of the loan to hire laborers to work in his field.

Nhao is 50 years old and the father of six children, four of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. His wife, Mrs. Kel Choeurn, shown on the left in the photo, is a chicken breeder.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his land and fuel for his irrigation system, and to hire laborers to work on his field.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia T. is 28 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children -- two males and two females -- who are all currently in the basic school. Her husband is a palm nut farmer. Cecelia lives with her family in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the residents, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities.

Cecelia produces palm oil out of palm nuts. She procures palm fruits from nearby farms to add to what she harvests from her husband’s farm. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail.

She wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute it to the increasing number of her customers. She aspires to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Adela María

texts.es:
La señora Adela C. habita en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino en la ciudad de Managua. Se dedica a atender su propia pulpería que ha sido levantada producto de sus esfuerzos ya que se ha dedicado grandemente para sacar adelante su negocio.

A pesar de las difíciles situaciones económicas que ha atravesado, ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito porque requiere invertir en su negocio por medio de la compra de los productos de pulpería para ofertarlos en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Adela C. lives in the township of Ciudad Sandino in the city of Managua. She tends her own general store which has been built as a product of her endeavours, as she has greatly devoted herself to carry on her business. Despite the difficult financial situations she has come through, she has turned to Ceprodel to receive a loan because she needs to invest in her business by means of the purchase of general store merchandise to offer it for sale in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela cuenta 32 años de edad, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos. Junto a su esposo se dedica a sembrar papas y alverjas, durante estos meses de cosecha hay bonanza por lo que trata de acumular sus ingresos económicos, para utilizarlos como capital en los próximos cultivos de papa. A las 4.00am Adela inicia sus labores de ama de casa, después, a las 9.00am alista sus viandas donde carga el almuerzo de su esposo y el suyo para ir a trabajar a sus chacras. En esta época la siembra de papas les ha sido muy rentable, porque en el mercado les han cotizado a un buen precio, lo que la anima a seguir sembrando, las papas que nos muestra en la foto son de un tamaño seleccionado que tienen un precio mayor, y generalmente son enviados a los mercados de Lima por ser mucho más rentables. Adela está muy feliz con su actividad, tiene grandes anhelos de progresar a base de la agricultura y brindarles comodidad a su familia e hijos. Este es su 9no crédito con MFP, y que en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una cliente muy eficiente y puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora viene solicitando es para mandar a arar con tractor su chacra descansada (sin producir) de hace varios años, y con otra parte comprará insecticidas contra los gusanos.
texts.en:
Adela is 32 years old, lives with her partner and father of their 3 children. Together with her husband they plant potatoes and peas, during these harvesting months there is enough prosperity to build their income, in order to use the capital in the next round of potato crops. At 4:00 AM Adela begins her work as a housewife, after, at 9:00AM she prepares food for packed lunches for her and her husband to take while working their farmlands. Right now potato planting is very profitable, because of the good market price, which encourages her to continue planting. The potatoes shown in the photo are of the selected size that fetches the highest price, and are generally sent to the markets in Lima to be more profitable.

Adela is very happy with this activity, and has high hopes to progress on the basis of agricultural and provide more comfort for her family and children. This is her 9th loan with MFP, and all this time she has shown that she is a very punctual and efficient customer in her payments. The money she requests now is to buy a tractor to plow her farmland that has been unproductive for many years, and the other part will buy insecticides against worms.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for a tractor to plow their farmland.

loans.name: Neba Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a mother of two children. She runs a business buying and selling cocoyams in the Bamenda food market. Comfort will use this loan to buy 150,000 CFA worth of cocoyams (taro), which she will house in a market stall she rents. She will also use the loan to pay for transporting her cocoyams.

This is Comfort’s second loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 2007. She has been successful at selling her cocoyams because of her approach to attracting customers and her friendly demeanor. She also notes that keeping her stall clean, as well as providing quality cocoyams keeps her business running.

At age 25, Comfort has already experienced the loss of her father and has had to drop out of school and take care of her younger siblings and her children. She plans to use the profits of this loan to improve her standard of living, pay for her children’s school fees and help take care of her younger siblings. Comfort takes out GHAPE loans because the conditions of the loan work well for her and her business.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Neba Comfort  from  Cameroon

loans.use: To buy cocoyams, pay stall rent and pay for transportation.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
In Ukraine many people prefer shopping in the market. Irina is one of the market vendors who serve these clients. After trying out a couple of other business ventures, she found that she liked selling retail items the most. She credits her success to finding a good market opportunity and to receiving timely financial assistance from “Nadiya Ukraine.”  Her integrity and hard-working attitude have allowed her to establish her business and keep it stable.  Presently, Irina earns about 8,000 Grivnyas each month. 

After 15 years in business, Irina is requesting a loan of 15,000 Gryvnias in order to stock her retail space with new inventory, which she will be able to purchase in bulk. Irina and her husband Andrei are the proud parents of two daughters. Her desire is to increase her productivity and raise her net income so that she can continue to provide for her family.

loans.use: To increase merchandise inventory.

loans.name: Anwar Muhammad Noor Group

texts.en:
Kosar baji wants a loan to buy repairing tools for her bicycle-repairing business.

Razia baji wants a loan to buy embroidery material (colored thread, clothes and beads) for her decorative-embroidery business.

Naseem baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy a lathe. 

Anwar baji belongs to a conservative family. Her society was against educating girls and her parents were forced to conform. She feels being deprived of knowledge a blessing but she decided that this shouldn’t happen to her children. She has two children: one son and one daughter. Her children are very happy with her. Anwar baji operates a business sewing clothes to pay her children’s school fees.

Anwar baji married M. N. who is a salesman and sells bakery items. She is applying for a loan to buy bakery items (biscuits & chips) wholesale so that her husband is able to sell them to the grocery shops and increase his profit.

loans.use: To buy bakery items wholesale to sell

loans.name: Soumayé

texts.fr: Soumaye S. est une dame de 49 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle fait déjà du commerce de divers comme succre, riz poisson fumé. elle aimerait promouvoir son activité afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Soumaye S., 49, is married and the mother of 6 children. She already sells various items such as sugar, rice, and smoked fish. She would like to bolster her little business so as to better support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and resale of sugar, rice, and smoked fish

loans.name: Everlyne Nafula

texts.en: Everlyne S. is a modest businesswoman in Kakamega Town, Western Kenya. She is married to Harrison and they have two school-going children aged eight and four years. Everlyne presently sells various types of fish in Bukembe Market to earn a living. Fish is a popular dish in Western Kenya, and she has seen a remarkable growth in her business since she started it three years ago. Everlyne is taking her second loan from KADET and she intends to use it to purchase more fish stock. She wants to see further growth in her business to enable her to diversify into farming activities. For now she is happy that she can afford to educate her two children. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more fish stock

loans.name: Sherlie

texts.en:
Sherlie S. is from the town of Panaon. She is 30 years old. Sherlie is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Sherlie owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Sherlie has has her business for over four years and earns approximately 70,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Sherlie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sherlie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. Sherlie is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Sherlie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: John Mugo

texts.en:
John C. is 34-years-old, married to Mary and they have two children. He has been in the vehicle repairs business for the past 15 years now. His business is located along Eldoret- kisumu highway road and his clients include farmers and residences within Eldoret Town.

John was a founder of a group and he was among the first clients of KADET.With the loan he is taking from KADET he intends to buy a cylinder and pistons.

In future he wants to grow his business to a large manufacturing shop and to diversify by opening another branch at Kapsabet town 62 km from Eldoret Town.



About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts which include pistons.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La señora Faustina pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Juan D. Tahuaco”  que esta ubicado en la comunidad D. San Juan D. Tahuaco del distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 57 años D. edad, estado civil casada y es madre D. 09 hijos y No tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, vive en la comunidad D. san Juan D. Tahuaco.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años es una D. las socias fundadoras,  con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra D. ganado menor. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, con este préstamo la señora va a comprar ganado mayor para engorD., también trabajo con su criadero D. truchas con la ayuda D. su esposo.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las facilidades den los préstamos.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado mayor para engorde.

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.es: La señora Maria Lucrecia S. de 41 años de edad, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, con una hija de 13 años que estudia la secundaria, sus planes es poder terminar de construir su casa, ya que todavía su piso es de suelo, le falta repellar paredes y desea tener una casa digna para su familia. Anteriormente vendía productos de cosméticos pero las ventas se pusieron bajas y no le alcanzaba para cubrir sus gastos lo cual busco un empleo fijo y ahora trabaja de conserje en un colegio americano para tener su salario fijo y poder cubrir sus gastos, a un vende cosméticos en poca proporción a sus clientes para poder mejorar su economía. Con este crédito es su tercer ciclo en Afodenic el cual invertirá en la compra de zinc y otros materiales para reparar el techo de su casa que esta en mal estado. Da la gracia a la institución por el préstamo ya que hace posible hacer las mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Lucrecia S. is 41 years old, and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. She has a 13-year old daughter who is in secondary school. Her plan is to finish construction on her house, which still has a ground floor of dirt, and is lacking plaster on the walls. She desires to have a decent home for her family. Previously, she sold cosmetics but the sales were low, and did not cover her expenses, which caused her to look for a steady job. She now works as a janitor at an American school in order to have a fixed salary and be able to cover her expenses, and she sells a small amount of cosmetics to her customers in order to improve her economic situation. This loan will begin her third cycle with AFODENIC, and will be used to purchase zinc and other materials to repair the roof of her house, which is in bad condition. She is grateful to the institution for this loan, since it will now be possible to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy zinc and other materials to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Rosália Armando

texts.pt:
Rosália T. é natural de Maputo tem 29 anos de idade é solteira não tem filhos vive numa casa alugada. Frequenta a escola, neste momento esta concluindo o ensino médio.

Ela trabalha na Educação como professora a mais de 5 anos das 7h as 12h todos os dias da semana e aufere 4.700.00mt que aplica no sustento da família e poupa algum dinheiro no banco comercial, Barclays.

Foi formada pelo Centro de formação de professores de Namaacha a 6 anos.
Com este empréstimo de 15.000.00mt pretende comprar material de construção, concretamente cimento, ferro, chapas de zinco e outros.

Nunca pediu empréstimos em outras instituições financeiras. Conheceu a Hluvuku pela Eva Nunes amiga dela e cliente da mesma instituição.
Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku sendo os anteriores de 10.200.00mt e 12.000.00mt. 
O seu grande desafio é terminar a Obra e viver na sua própria casa, para tal pretende pagar bem este empréstimo e pedir mais. No futuro gostaria de levantar créditos para conclusão da obra e compra de mobiliário.
texts.en:
Rosália T. is a native of Maputo. She is 29 years old, single, does not have children, and lives in a rented house. She goes to school and is currently finishing her secondary education. She has worked in education as a teacher for more than five years, from 7:00 a.m. to 12:00 noon every day of the week, and earns 4,700 MT which she uses for the support of her family, putting a little money aside in Barclays, the commercial bank. She graduated from the Teachers Training Centre of Namaacha six years ago. With this loan of 15,000 MT, she plans to purchase construction materials, specifically cement, iron, corrugated iron, and other things. She has never requested a loan from other financial institutions. She came to know about Hluvuku through Eva Nunes, a friend of hers and a client of this same institution. This is her third loan with Hluvuku, the previous ones being for 10,200 MT and 12,000 MT. Her great challenge is to finish construction and live in her own house, and for that she plans to pay this loan back and request another. In the future, she would like to raise loans to finish construction and purchase furniture.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material (cement, corrugated iron and other materials)

loans.name: Hermane

texts.en:
Hermane P. is from the village of Bolisong, Kinoguitan, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old. Hermane is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Hermane operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of banana products and other items in the local community. Hermane has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Hermane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hermane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Hermane is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Hermane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Tevy

texts.en:
Mr. Tevy P., age 24, is single and is living with his parents in a small village along the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Tevy has been working for a restaurant for one year. He hopes to organize his house where he lives to become neat, so he is applying for a loan of $500 to make the repairs.

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: San

texts.en: San P., 33, is married with two school-age children. She lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she runs a grocery store at home, earning $5 US per day. Her husband helps his wife with the business and he is a motorbike repairman, earning approximately $2 US per day. P. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, P. is asking for a loan of $700 US to purchase a variety of groceries to restock her store. She hopes that her plan of expanding her business will be successful so that she is able to handle more customers.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to restock the store

loans.name: Constantin

texts.en:
Constantin is 33 years old and is single. he lives in Gasabo, a region of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. Here Constantin has owned a shop selling foodstuffs including cooking oil, salt, sugar, etc., since 2007 working from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Constantin realized that his profit is still too low to expand meaningfully and he believes that a small amount of additional capital would change his business progressively. To do this, he is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. he will use the loan to purchase additional foodstuffs such as rice, flour, etc., so that he may attract new customers and increase his sales and (hopefully) profits as well.

With the continued success of his business, Constantin will be able to build a secure future for his business as well as saving to cover any financial problems.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil, salt, sugar and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to two children who are both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing-dominated community in the central region of Ghana. Rosemary is a fashion designer. She designs and sews dresses for sale and also for clients who place orders. She works in a shop by the road in her community. She has two apprentices under her training. Rosemary has been in business for seven years and desires to give her business a face-lift. She wants the loan to procure many kinds of printed fabric and other accessories in bulk to achieve this dream.

loans.use: To buy printed fabric and other accessories in bulk

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
El Señor  Silvio Rodríguez C., Labora como  Oficial Mantenimiento en el Mercado Roberto Huembés,
 El tiene dos hijos a su cargo, los dos  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante cuatro años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 5 créditos en el mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción: ladrillo, cemento, etc. para la remodelación del piso de la vivienda en la que habita y el pago de la mano de obra, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 
Silvio dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel su vivienda ha venido mejorando
texts.en:
Silvio Rodríguez C. works as a maintenance officer in the Roberto Huembés market in Managua. He is married with two children, both of whom are school aged. He has acquired several loans through Kiva partner CEPRODEL over the last four years. In this time, he has applied the proceeds of five loans granted through CEPRODEL to home renovations for his residence. He is an excellent client. The requested loan will be used to purchase construction materials: bricks, cement, etc., to remodel the floor of the home in which he lives as well as to pay for manual labor. His objective is to provide better security and living conditions for his children. Silvio attests that, thanks to the loans granted through Kiva partner CEPRODEL, his home has continued to improve.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home renovations.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is an educated young man who lives in Beit Hanoun, in Gaza/Palestine. His village is located in an Ottoman area near the Israeli borders. Beit Hanoun is known for beautiful citrus and almond trees, as well as for raising cattle and goats. Ahmad is only 20 years old, but very well experienced in raising his livestock. He lives with his family and is ambitious to finish his education. He requested a loan of $3000 to expand his business by buying sheep and feed and eventually a bigger hut. Ahmad is unique in his integrity and high ambitions, and there is no doubt he will succeed in his project.

loans.use: To buy sheep, expand his hut and increase production

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther B. is a 20-year-old single lady. She owns a beauty salon in the Barisheba area in Mikoroshoni, Mombasa. Her business has been in existence for the last four years and is doing well. B. says that most of her clients are the young residents living in the area.

Esther is a member of Nadhani Nitafaulu SHG in KADET Mombasa. She was introduced to KADET, a Kiva partner, by an existing member of the group and this is her first time borrowing. She intends to use this money to purchase some beauty products and hair chemicals for the salon. She also hopes to do minor repairs and fixes in her salon to make it more appealing to her clients.

Her dream is to see her business grow and she hopes to open more beauty salons later.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and hair chemicals and to perform minor repairs in her salon

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Isata B. is 60 years old,divorced with two children, both boys. The two children are already working. Isata lives in Tegbeh town, an area of Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone.

Isata sells rice, groundnuts, pepper and onions in Tegbeh town market and has been a LAPO, SL client for over two years now as a member of a credit union (a loan group that serves as collateral and guarantor for LAPO, SL clients). She has taken out four previous loans since she joined. With her previous loans she bought the same goods for sale and used her profits to pay her children's school fees.

Isata wants to use her present loan of 1,500,000 leones to buy more of her goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more rice, groundnuts, pepper and onions

loans.name: Thelma Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Thelma Argentina Munguia tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropa ubicado en su localidad en el mercado central de Chinandega.Ella vende ropa de toda clase tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. 

Ella trabaja arduamente para suplir los gastos de su hogar y la razón única por la que está solicitando el crédito hoy en día es para invertirlo en la compra de la ropa ya que la necesita a lo inmediato para continuar comercializandola y de esta manera obtener los ingresos pertinentes y sobre todo suplir la demanda de sus clientes en su localidad.
texts.en:
Thelma Argentina Munguia C. has a business in her house, which is two blocks away from the central market. She sells all types of clothing and sometimes buys clothing in bulk for adults, teens or children, depending on how much money she has saved up. She has two children, but neither of them depend on her financially. She works for herself and to cover her household expenses. This is the first loan Thelma has taken out with Ceprodel. She came to us because she was tired of working with lenders who squeeze everything out of small business owners, and so she decided to look into the loans that Ceprodel offers. She expects to keep working with us and, with God's help, to pay off her loans on time.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bulk purchase of children's clothing

loans.name: Azetou

texts.en: Azetou A. is 38 years old, married to a taxi driver, and has three children. She works in the Adidogomé district of Lomé, Togo, selling charcoal, millet, corn and sorgho. She purchases her supplies from the northern part of the country, and then sells her products from home in the south. This will be her third loan with Kiva partner, WAGES, which she will use to resupply her stock. Not only will this loan help support her business, but her family as well.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal, millet, corn and sorgho

loans.name: J.temporada's Group

texts.en:
Jennie T. is from the village of Lumbayao, Aloran Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Jennie is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jennie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jennie owns & operates a sari-sari store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jennie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jennie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Jennie has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Jennie is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Jennie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida is 39 years old and lives with her husband and one teenage son in the city of Borewala, Pakistan. She and her family live together in a single-roomed house.

Currently, Sajida operates a business sewing clothes while her husband is a painter. They have been operating their businesses for over fifteen years, and have steadily expanded them. Her husband, F. H., paints windows and doors and Sajida sews clothes for her neighbors. Their businesses are well known to their customers. With the profit, they purchased a color television and a fridge.

Sajida has been a client of Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan) for the last two years. Now she is applying for a loan for the third time to start a business selling paint. She and her husband have the expectation that the new business will give them good earnings which will help them to provide a better lifestyle to their son.

loans.use: To start a business selling paint

loans.name: Rosa Mariana

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es una gran mujer muy dedicada al trabajo, pese a que es una persona con capacidades especiales, nos comentó que se siente satisfecha con su trabajo, que consiste en la venta de comida rápida,  para ello cuenta con la ayuda de su hija mayor que es quien se encarga de preparar los alimentos. Desde hace varios ciclos es socia del Banco Comunal Damas En Progreso, con los créditos que ha recibido por parte de la Fundación su negocio ha ido en aumento, ahora podrá invertir en arreglar el lugar donde tiene su negocio y poder comprar mas alimentos como plátanos. Queso y aceites.


A sus 58 años es una mujer bastante activa, es viuda hace 13 años y sus hijos han sido el apoyo, ellos ya son adultos y tienen sus familias; el sueño de nuestra socia es poder seguir ayudando a sus dos nietos que ella tiene a su cargo, ya que son huérfanos, y ella es la que les ha brindado el cuidado y quiere que sigan estudiando para verlos realizados.
texts.en:
Rosa is a great lady, and very hard working. She is a person with special skills - she told us she feels satisfaction in her work, which is the sale of fast food. She is helped by her eldest daughter who prepares the food. For some time, she has been a member of the Women in Progress Communal Bank. Through the loans she has received from the Foundation, her store has grown. Now she'll be able to invest in improvements to the space where she operates her shop and buy more food such as bananas, cheese, and oils. At 58 years of age, she is a very active woman. She has been a widow for 13 years and her children have provided a her with lot of support, as they are grown with families of their own. Her dream is to be able to continue helping her two orphaned grandchildren, who are in her care. She is the one who has supported and cared for them and she wants them to pursue their studies and be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, meat, potatoes, bananas, cheese, vegetables

loans.name: Ream

texts.en: Mrs. Ream C., 52, is a villager who lives in Voat Svay village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns four hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living. In order to support this farm, Mrs. Ream C. decided to ask for a loan to purchase two wheels for her plowing machine and to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline. Aside from farming she also breeds pigs and ducks, which adds to the family income. Mrs. Ream C. is widow with three children: one is seamstress in a garment factory, one is a farmer who helps with the farm, and the youngest is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase two wheels for the plowing machine and to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en: Mwajuma C., a small entrepreneur, runs a business selling fried food (chicken chips) at  Kigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases her products (potatoes, cooking oil, and charcoal) from the city market shops and then sells to her customers. The business income enables her to meet her family's daily needs and business capitalization. Mwajuma is now requesting a loan of T.shs 700,000 to purchase supplies for her business.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes, cooking oil, and charcoal
